Consumable_Stamina_01.description: A stim that lowers the consumption of stamina for 2 minutes.

Consumable_Grenade_01.name: Weak Grenade
Consumable_Grenade_01.description: A thrown explosive device that detonates after a short delay.

Consumable_Grenade_02.name: Light Grenade
Consumable_Grenade_02.description: A thrown explosive device that detonates after a short delay.

Consumable_Grenade_03.name: Standard Grenade
Consumable_Grenade_03.description: A thrown explosive device that detonates after a short delay.

Consumable_Grenade_04.name: Heavy Grenade
Consumable_Grenade_04.description: A thrown explosive device that detonates after a short delay.

Consumable_Grenade_05.name: Assault Grenade
Consumable_Grenade_05.description: A thrown explosive device that detonates after a short delay.

Consumable_HowlerGrenade.name: Howler Grenade
Consumable_HowlerGrenade.description: A thrown device, developed by Osiris, that detonates after a short delay and disorients and slows targets in a radius.

Consumable_SmokeGrenade_01.name: Smoke Grenade
Consumable_SmokeGrenade_01.description: A non-lethal grenade that covers an area in thick smoke.

Consumable_GasGrenade_01.name: Gas Grenade
Consumable_GasGrenade_01.description: A grenade that covers an area in lethal poisonous gas.

Consumable_AudioDecoy_01.name: Audio Decoy
Consumable_AudioDecoy_01.description: A small device that emits the sounds of fake gunfire to distract enemies.

Consumable_Barrier_01.name: Kinetic Barrier
Consumable_Barrier_01.description: An energy barrier that blocks any projectiles.

Consumable_Cloak_01.name: Cloak
Consumable_Cloak_01.description: Cloaks the user as long as it's active.

Consumable_Turret_01.name: Turret
Consumable_Turret_01.description: Deploys an automated turret that will engage any hostiles in view.

Consumable_Shield_01.name: Shield Charger
Consumable_Shield_01.description: A device that replenishes part of the missing shield.

Abilities_Cloak.name: Cloaking Device
Abilities_Cloak.description: Makes the operator nearly invisible for a short period, as long as the operator doesn't fire their weapon.
Abilities_Cloak.lore: Cloaking technology like this never became popular due to the large variety of scanning methods available to military elements, but they've retained their popularity among criminal elements and those running small covert jobs.

Abilities_Cloak_Ambush.name: Evasion Cloak
Abilities_Cloak_Ambush.description: A cloaking device that provide user with a small speed boost while cloaked.
Abilities_Cloak_Ambush.lore: Originally intended to be an ambusher cloak, with the field around the user providing a noticeable speed boost to anything emitted from within it to improve offensive potential, the in that configuration the cloak was found to rapidly irradiate into the surroundings with whatever object was inside it. According to internal documents, no tests on human operators were ever performed, though Korolev was never known for keeping accurate or truthful records.  Fortunately for the company, a simple inversion (and massive powering down) of the field was found to provide operators with a useful boost to their movement speed, though at the cost of increasing that of anything impacting the field. The field manual however has this covered, sternly advising the user with 'Don't get shot'.

Abilities_Cloak_Still.name: Concealment Cloak
Abilities_Cloak_Still.description: A cloaking device that significantly improves effectiveness when static, at the cost of lower effectiveness when moving.
Abilities_Cloak_Still.lore: Osiris opted to reinvent the wheel on this one, believing existing cloaking technology was simply lacking in its purported goal of actually cloaking the user. Plus it seemed cheaper and easier than paying the lawyers to figure out who still owned the rights to existing cloaking tech and dealing with whatever clods had come up with the original design.  This new cloak was capable of completely hiding its operator from view and conventional optic sensors, though it had the slight drawback of completely immobilizing the user while active (technically, operators could move, though it would cause excruciating pain and the cloak is unable to mute screams). With some fine-tuning the device was made to be slightly less effective while the operator attempted to remain perfectly still, and still allow full movement while active, though even a light gait will cause the cloak to shimmer brightly.

Abilities_KineticShield.name: Kinetic Barrier
Abilities_KineticShield.description: An energy barrier to protect from incoming attacks.
Abilities_KineticShield.lore: Based on the same technology used to defend starships and stations from munitions and space debris for hundreds of years, the Kinetic Shield can project a small barrier able to take significant punishment before collapsing.  Thanks to some clever tech the AI controller on a prospector's suit is able to tell the barrier which projectiles and energy emissions to let through and which not, allowing the barrier's owner to fire through it while shielding them from oncoming fire.

Abilities_KineticShield_Shell.name: Protective Shell
Abilities_KineticShield_Shell.description: Deploys a kinetic shell that provides a short lived shield around the user, preventing them from taking or dealing damage for several seconds.
Abilities_KineticShield_Shell.lore: The Protective Shell can be a real lifesaver, able to give a surprised prospector a chance to react to an ambush or stop an incoming missile from, well, doing what missiles do. And while it makes its user practically invulnerable without affecting their own weapons, the Shell's energy consumption is far too great to stay active for long.  Still, the tech has improved significantly since the first prototypes... between operators trapped in a rolling energy-egg rolling around the testing ground and discovering the need for strict user height limitations, the device is now almost completely safe to use!

Abilities_KineticShield_Dome.name: Safeguard
Abilities_KineticShield_Dome.description: A kinetic dome that covers a larger area with a strong shield that blocks both enemy and friendly fire.
Abilities_KineticShield_Dome.lore: The Safeguard was developed for use in warzones where mission critical buildings and equipment were meant to be kept protected at all times from enemy fire, without impeding their actual use. While it can cover a larger area and take on more damage than the standard barrier, it doesn't discriminate friend or foe, allowing both to pass through the barrier freely, while also blocking all weapons' fire.  Some prospectors tinkered with prototypes that blocked movement entirely, the concept was quickly dropped; while this was found to be a useful way of keeping bad things out, it also had the unforeseen side effect of trapping its user inside, possibly with something they don't want to be near; a popular video typically shown to bright-eyed station arrivals shows the effects of a prospector missing the timing when attempting to block an incoming Warden Alpha. Good way to sober them up, and to remind people to not mod their abilities.

Abilities_Bombardment.name: Orbital Bombardment
Abilities_Bombardment.description: Marks an area to be targeted by remotely launched explosives.
Abilities_Bombardment.lore: With countless satelites orbiting Fortuna III, it's only natural that some would carry weaponry. Some of these can be commanded by Prospectors, assuming they've paid the relevant ownership fees.  While a prospector's suit is able to detect incoming fire (or rather the targeting signal marking the desired impact coordinates) and take evasive action, fire from the sky always comes as a surprise to the hostile creatures of Fortuna III.

Abilities_Bombardment_Precision.name: Precision Strike
Abilities_Bombardment_Precision.description: An orbital bombardment that delivers high damage onto a small area.
Abilities_Bombardment_Precision.lore: With countless satellites orbiting Fortuna III, it's only natural that some would carry weaponry. Some of these can be commanded by Prospectors, assuming they've paid the relevant ownership fees.  A smaller and denser projectile, this'll leave a lasting impression on whatever's unlucky enough to get hit by it.

Abilities_Bombardment_Cluster.name: Orbital Barrage
Abilities_Bombardment_Cluster.description: An orbital bombardment that delivers a barrage of small impacts over a large area.
Abilities_Bombardment_Cluster.lore: With countless satellites orbiting Fortuna III, it's only natural that some would carry weaponry. Some of these can be commanded by Prospectors, assuming they've paid the relevant ownership fees.  'What if, instead of one big cannon, we installed a bunch of heavy machineguns on our satellites?'  'What if' indeed.

Abilities_BlinkDagger.name: Directional Warp
Abilities_BlinkDagger.description: Fires a warp point through which the operator will be transported, or on demand while warp point is in transit.
Abilities_BlinkDagger.lore: While teleporting technology in itself isn't new, it's traditionally required a fixed device at the destination point to safely transmit matter without reconstruction errors; this new Warp device operates by using an unstable phase construct as its end point.  Pay no heed to reports of the technology only just being approved for testing on single-cell organisms in Federation controlled space.

Abilities_BlinkDagger_Damage.name: Warp Bomb
Abilities_BlinkDagger_Damage.description: A directional warp device that emits a damaging explosion at the warp exit point.
Abilities_BlinkDagger_Damage.lore: While teleporting technology in itself isn't new, it's traditionally required a fixed device at the destination point to safely transmit matter without reconstruction errors; this new Warp device operates by using an unstable phase construct as its end point.  The unstable part is key here. Turns out with some small tweaks you can syphon the energy mean to stabilize the warp transfer into a small energy blast just as the transfer initiates. Unfortunately the warp projectile's speed had to be reduced to compensate, though this was only discovered after testing.  Junior Researcher Ricardo Galvin is still on sabbatical and Korolev has no time for spurious speculation on his whereabouts.

Abilities_HealingWard.name: Shield Generator
Abilities_HealingWard.description: A device that emits a static energy field to assist Prospector's kit's healing rate.
Abilities_HealingWard.lore: Little more than a canister full of medical nanites and a weak energy field to keep them powered, it can still bring a Prospector back from the brink of death. Most of these devices are synced with their owner. You know, to not waste energy and all that.

Abilities_HealingWard_Harm.name: Skirmish Sphere
Abilities_HealingWard_Harm.description: A sphere that covers a larger area and harms hostiles.
Abilities_HealingWard_Harm.lore: The usually docile nanites of the medical triage sphere are suspiciously agitated in this particular device, giving the energy field a menacing hue.  While most of these devices are synced with their owner to heal them, this one actively instructs the nanite cloud to harm other entities. 'Harm' in this context means 'hundreds of thousands of miniscule floating robot crabs slicing through living matter cell by cell'.  Fun.

Abilities_HealingWard_Attached.name: Healing Aura
Abilities_HealingWard_Attached.description: A triage sphere attached to the operator, but less healing power.
Abilities_HealingWard_Attached.lore: Little more than a canister full of medical nanites and a weak energy field to keep them powered, it can still bring a Prospector back from the brink of death.  Regular Healing Wards have are too delicate to be moved around, as the nanites inside would float away out of their energy containment field. This one keeps a stronger field, ensuring all those little robots are trapped in their energy prison for the remainder of their very short lives. Also the field is smaller, requires more energy to concentrate the barrier limit or something.

Abilities_TurretHeavy.name: Heavy Turret
Abilities_TurretHeavy.description: Calls down a heavy automated turret that will engage any hostiles in view.
Abilities_TurretHeavy.lore: Nothing says 'Korolev' like a vehicle mounted cannon bolted onto an all-terrain platform capable of being dropped from orbit into the middle of a battlefield.

Abilities_SnareMine.name: Snare Trap
Abilities_SnareMine.description: A small device that will tether hostiles to its anchored location for a short duration, this does not include prospectors..
Abilities_SnareMine.lore: While the ICA developed traps like these to be used against Squatters, they're more often than not used by Prospectors to entangle their competitors in chokepoints or near items of interest, leaving them vulnerable to ambush.

Abilities_OTecStim.name: Shield charger
Abilities_OTecStim.description: A device that replenishes part of the missing shield.
Abilities_OTecStim.lore: Oh yeah, just inject yourself with about two million tiny little robots, what ever could possibly go wrong?  (historically, a lot, but we finally got the tech right, honest!)

Abilities_OTecStim_02.name: Health Boost
Abilities_OTecStim_02.description: A stim that gives an immediate health boost, initiates health regeneration and temporarily increase damage resistance.
Abilities_OTecStim_02.lore: Oh yeah, just inject yourself with about two million tiny little robots, what ever could possibly go wrong?  (historically, a lot, but we finally got the tech right, honest!)

Abilities_OTecStim_Adrenaline.name: Adrenaline Shot
Abilities_OTecStim_Adrenaline.description: A stim that increases movement speed.

Abilities_OTecStim_StandGround.name: Stand Your Ground
Abilities_OTecStim_StandGround.description: A stim that temporarily halves damage received, at the cost of reducing the movement speed.
Abilities_OTecStim_StandGround.lore: Similar to the regular health stim, this one charges the nanites into overdrive so they harden specific user's soft tissues and flood traumatized areas with healing serums. Hardening tissues does mean an overall reduction in movement due to stiffness, but that's a price a surprising number of people seem willing to pay.

Abilities_OTecGrenade.name: Shock Grenade
Abilities_OTecGrenade.description: Light grenade explodes after a few seconds or on contact with hostiles.

Abilities_BounceGrenade.name: Trench Grenade
Abilities_BounceGrenade.description: Heavy grenade that explodes after several seconds.
Abilities_BounceGrenade.lore: It's a grenade.  You throw it, it explodes.

Abilities_OTecGrenade_02.name: Shock Grenade
Abilities_OTecGrenade_02.description: Light grenade explodes after a few seconds or on contact with hostiles.
Abilities_OTecGrenade_02.lore: It's a grenade.  You throw it, it explodes.

Abilities_SurveillanceWard.name: Surveillance Ward
Abilities_SurveillanceWard.description: A deployable scanner that reveals prospectors and objectives on the map.
Abilities_SurveillanceWard.lore: A disposable, orbital-dropped scanner, Osiris uses these to find the best mineral deposits on the surface, but isn't adverse to launching them for Prospectors with high enough standing.  If you hear a sort of beeping sound coming from the scanner, that's actually its scan pulses reverberating inside your skull and impacting some dense matter. You might want to get that checked out.

Abilities_SnareMine_Event_01.name: Holiday Snare Trap
Abilities_SnareMine_Event_01.description: Every prospector loves running into surprise presents from strangers!  A small device that will tether its lucky finder to its anchored location for a short duration while administring joyful electric charges.
Abilities_SnareMine_Event_01.lore: NOTE: This item will only be available during the holidays!

Abilities_OTecGrenade_02_Event_01.name: Holiday Grenade
Abilities_OTecGrenade_02_Event_01.description: A generous gift to hand around.  Light grenade explodes after a few seconds or on contact with anyone that isn't your friend yet.
Abilities_OTecGrenade_02_Event_01.lore: NOTE: This item will only be available during the holidays!

Abilities_TurretHeavy_Event_01.name: Holiday Turret
Abilities_TurretHeavy_Event_01.description: Let this little helper deliver for you.  Orders down a heavy automated turret that will engage any grumps in view for its 90 second lifetime. Will attack any Prospector not enjoying the holidays with its owner. Only one can be active at a time.
Abilities_TurretHeavy_Event_01.lore: NOTE: This item will only be available during the holidays!

Abilities_TurretHeavy_Ouroboros.name: Energy Turret
Abilities_TurretHeavy_Ouroboros.description: Calls down a heavy automated turret that will engage any non-human hostiles in view.
Abilities_TurretHeavy_Ouroboros.lore: Built from a schematic found on Fortuna III, this turret carries a mix of pre and post-Cycle technology to fire concentrated balls of plasma, similar to how Spitters and other beasts use the Cycle's unique energy for lethal purposes. Its overall performance is comparable to the standard Korolev Heavy Turret, but it will not attack human enemies.

Consumable_Health_05.name: Strong Medkit
Consumable_Health_05.description: Slow application. Provides a massive health boost.

Consumable_Health_06.name: Combat Medkit
Consumable_Health_06.description: Slow application. Provides a full health boost.

Contract_Easy-KOR-Minerals-1.description: Use your Pickaxe or a Mining Tool to mine minerals for Flawed Veltecite Using a Scanner will help in finding mineral deposits in rocky areas or dig sites

Contract_Medium-KOR-Minerals-1.name: Veltecite Run II
Contract_Medium-KOR-Minerals-1.description: Use your Pickaxe or a Mining Tool to mine minerals for Flawed Veltecite Using a Scanner will help in finding mineral deposits in rocky areas or dig sites

Contract_Hard-KOR-Minerals-1.description: Use your Pickaxe or a Mining Tool to mine minerals for Flawed Veltecite Using a Scanner will help in finding mineral deposits in rocky areas or dig sites

Contract_Easy-KOR-Minerals-2.name: Crystal Frenzy I
Contract_Easy-KOR-Minerals-2.description: Use your Pickaxe or a Mining Tool to mine minerals for Cloudy Veltecite Using a Scanner will help in finding mineral deposits in rocky areas or dig sites

Contract_Medium-KOR-Minerals-2.name: Crystal Frenzy II
Contract_Medium-KOR-Minerals-2.description: Use your Pickaxe or a Mining Tool to mine minerals for Clear Veltecite Using a Scanner will help in finding mineral deposits in rocky areas or dig sites

Contract_Hard-KOR-Minerals-2.name: Crystal Frenzy III
Contract_Hard-KOR-Minerals-2.description: Use your Pickaxe or a Mining Tool to mine minerals for Pure Veltecite Using a Scanner will help in finding mineral deposits in rocky areas or dig sites

Contract_Hard-KOR-Minerals-3.name: Geologist
Contract_Hard-KOR-Minerals-3.description: Search for glowing Polonium deposits within an active storm and extract them using your pickaxe or mining tool

Contract_Easy-ICA-BossHunt-1.name: Big Game Hunter I
Contract_Easy-ICA-BossHunt-1.description: Bring back an Alpha Crusher Skull Alpha Crushers are attracted to Alpha Crusher bait Print or buy it and place it at a nest

Contract_Medium-ICA-BossHunt-1.name: Big Game Hunter II
Contract_Medium-ICA-BossHunt-1.description: Bring back Alpha Crusher Skulls Alpha Crushers are attracted to Alpha Crusher bait Print or buy it and place it at a nest

Contract_Hard-ICA-BossHunt-1.name: Big Game Hunter III
Contract_Hard-ICA-BossHunt-1.description: Bring back Alpha Crusher Skulls Alpha Crushers are attracted to Alpha Crusher bait Print or buy it and place it at a nest

Contract_Easy-Osiris-Brightcaps-1.name: Naturalist I
Contract_Easy-Osiris-Brightcaps-1.description: Bring back Brightcap Mushrooms Brightcaps tend to grow in swampy areas Look out for Ticks, these explosive bugs feed on them

Contract_Medium-Osiris-Brightcaps-1.name: Naturalist II
Contract_Medium-Osiris-Brightcaps-1.description: Bring back Brightcap Mushrooms Brightcaps tend to grow in swampy areas Look out for Ticks, these explosive bugs feed on them

Contract_Hard-Osiris-Brightcaps-1.name: Naturalist III
Contract_Hard-Osiris-Brightcaps-1.description: Bring back Brightcap Mushrooms Brightcaps tend to grow in swampy areas Look out for Ticks, these explosive bugs feed on them

Contract_Hard-Osiris-Brightcaps-2.name: Storm Botanist
Contract_Hard-Osiris-Brightcaps-2.description: Bring back Glowy Brightcap Mushrooms These can only be harvested in swampy areas during the storm Keep an eye out for their purple tint

Contract_Easy-Osiris-Hunt-1.name: Pest Control I
Contract_Easy-Osiris-Hunt-1.description: Hunt down hostile creatures and bring back proof of kill Be careful, some beasts are tough!

Contract_Medium-Osiris-Hunt-1.name: Pest Control II
Contract_Medium-Osiris-Hunt-1.description: Hunt down hostile creatures and bring back proof of kill Be careful, some beasts are tough!

Contract_Hard-Osiris-Hunt-1.name: Pest Control III
Contract_Hard-Osiris-Hunt-1.description: Hunt down hostile creatures and bring back proof of kill Be careful, some beasts are tough!

Contract_Hard-Osiris-Hunt-2.name: Storm Biologist
Contract_Hard-Osiris-Hunt-2.description: Hunt down hostile creatures during an active storm and bring back proof of kill Be careful, some beasts are tough, especially while having to dodge lightning strikes!

Contract_Easy-KOR-LaserDrill-1.name: Heavy Driller I
Contract_Easy-KOR-LaserDrill-1.description: Complete a Laser Drill operation Use a Laser Drill Beacon on large Letium finds to call down a Drill, then activate and protect it The drill can carry you home if you remain inside when it takes off

Contract_Medium-KOR-LaserDrill-1.name: Heavy Driller II
Contract_Medium-KOR-LaserDrill-1.description: Complete a Laser Drill operation Use a Laser Drill Beacon on large Letium finds to call down a Drill, then activate and protect it The drill can carry you home if you remain inside when it takes off

Contract_Hard-KOR-LaserDrill-1.name: Heavy Driller III
Contract_Hard-KOR-LaserDrill-1.description: Complete a Laser Drill operation Use a Laser Drill Beacon on large Letium finds to call down a Drill, then activate and protect it The drill can carry you home if you remain inside when it takes off

Contract_Easy-ICA-PowerUp-1.description: Access the contents of a Secure Facility You will need to find Heavy Batteries on the surface to power up the facility

Contract_Medium-ICA-PowerUp-1.name: Batteries Not Included II
Contract_Medium-ICA-PowerUp-1.description: Access the contents of a Secure Facility You will need to find Heavy Batteries on the surface to power up the facility

Contract_Hard-ICA-PowerUp-1.name: Batteries Not Included III

Contract_Easy-ICA-Uplink-1.name: Big Data I
Contract_Easy-ICA-Uplink-1.description: Plug in a Data Drive at an Uplink Station (often located near large satellite dishes) Empty Data Drives can be purchased if you have none

Contract_Medium-ICA-Uplink-1.name: Big Data II
Contract_Medium-ICA-Uplink-1.description: Plug in a Data Drive at an Uplink Station (often located near large satellite dishes) Empty Data Drives can be purchased if you have none

Contract_Hard-ICA-Uplink-1.name: Big Data III
Contract_Hard-ICA-Uplink-1.description: Plug in a Data Drive at an Uplink Station (often located near large satellite dishes) Empty Data Drives can be purchased if you have none

Contract_Easy-ICA-StormSurge-1.name: Power Crystals I
Contract_Easy-ICA-StormSurge-1.description: Retrieve crystal samples created by Storm Surges You can locate a Storm Surge by the violent lightning strikes and the red tint of its radiation

Contract_Medium-ICA-StormSurge-1.name: Power Crystals II
Contract_Medium-ICA-StormSurge-1.description: Retrieve crystal samples created by Storm Surges You can locate a Storm Surge by the violent lightning strikes and the red tint of its radiation

Contract_Hard-ICA-StormSurge-1.name: Power Crystals III
Contract_Hard-ICA-StormSurge-1.description: Retrieve crystal samples created by Storm Surges You can locate a Storm Surge by the violent lightning strikes and the red tint of its radiation

Contract_Medium-Osiris-Tracking-1.name: Live Sample
Contract_Medium-Osiris-Tracking-1.description: Bring back a Blue Runner Egg Find Blue Runner tracks and follow them to their nest to steal an egg

Contract_Hard-Osiris-Minerals-1.name: Mineral Samples
Contract_Hard-Osiris-Minerals-1.description: Buy and equip a scanner Scan for minerals on rocky areas or dig sites Use your pickaxe to mine minerals for a chance to find Cloudy Veltecite

Contract_Hard-KOR-Uplink-1.name: Proprietary Information
Contract_Hard-KOR-Uplink-1.description: Buy and equip a Tier 1 Data Drive Plug the Data Drive into one of the Uplink stations on Fortuna III to gather valuable data Repeat until you find epic data

Contract_Medium-KOR-StormSurge-1.name: Surge Energy
Contract_Medium-KOR-StormSurge-1.description: On Fortuna III look for red storms Inside the storm area, collect red storm surge crystals Be careful, lethal lightning strikes fill the Spike area!

Contract_Easy-Osiris-Materials-1.name: Bad Optics I
Contract_Easy-Osiris-Materials-1.description: Bring back Optic Glass, often found in abandoned structures

Contract_Medium-Osiris-Materials-1.name: Bad Optics II
Contract_Medium-Osiris-Materials-1.description: Bring back Optic Glass, often found in abandoned structures

Contract_Hard-Osiris-Materials-1.name: Bad Optics III

Contract_Hard-KOR-Materials-1.name: Ordnance Disposal III
Contract_Hard-KOR-Materials-1.description: Bring back Derelict Explosives, often found in abandoned structures
