Main-ICA-Caverns-0.2-Unlock.description: Hmm. I think you've got what it takes for Tharis. Get us some valuables we can use to bribe your way past Korolev Security, we will take care of the rest.

Main-Osiris-Caverns-0.1-Unlock.description: We have received some intel on one of our old research sites potentially being ready to be reclaimed. The area was completely inaccessible due to radiation and terrifying creatures, but now the radiation seems to have faded.. at least a little. For the creatures, however, you are not ready yet. Keep being a valuable asset to us and we may grant you access to this area.
Main-Osiris-Caverns-0.1-Unlock.shortDescription: Prove to Osiris that you are ready to explore Tharis Island by increasing your Reputation Level.

Main-Osiris-Caverns-0.2-Unlock.description: Ah, our most efficient Prospector. Good. I think you should be able to handle exploring Tharis now. Bring us the parts we need to improve your drop pod so you don't go up in flames as you drop to the Island.

NEW-Hard-KOR-Howler-1.name: Winged Pests
NEW-Hard-KOR-Howler-1.description: Prospector, we need your help. These damned Howlers that just... uh, randomly appeared during our mining operations, they are becoming a real problem for our personnel! Clear the skies for us a little, OK?

NEW-Hard-ICA-Howler-1.name: Biomimicry
NEW-Hard-ICA-Howler-1.description: Ah, there you are. We need to get our hands on one of those Howler Darts, they might have a potential for military applications. And who better to take care of that than our finest Prospector? You'll need to stash it somewhere safe for our research team.

NEW-Hard-Osiris-Howler-1.name: Between dark clouds
NEW-Hard-Osiris-Howler-1.description: Hmm. This Howler creature seems to react to the Storm in some strange way, but we still don't understand the connection yet. Go hunt one during a Storm.

Main-KOR-Questline-Stormdivers.name: STORM DIVERS: Forged in the Storm
Main-KOR-Questline-Stormdivers.description: Freak storms have appeared over Fortuna III, with two shrouding Crescent Falls and Tharis Island. Higher storm frequency, more aggressive lightning strikes... There's great risk here, but also great opportunity and rewards!  Be a Stormdiver for Korolev, drop directly into an active storm, prove you can handle Fortuna III's worst by completing missions and handing in Storm Diver Commissions.  Korolev has fabricated additional gear just for Storm Divers, available in crates around drop pod locations in Crescent Falls and Tharis lsland.

Main-ICA-Questline-Stormdivers.name: STORM DIVERS: Storm Breaker
Main-ICA-Questline-Stormdivers.description: Crescent Falls and Tharis Island are affected by a new kind of storm, with more frequent surges and deadlier lightning strikes. The supply of raw and salvaged materials has been crippled, and it's up to you to keep the station from falling apart!  Be a Stormdiver for the ICA, drop directly into active storms, complete missions, and hand in Storm Diver Commissions. The station needs its best!  The ICA has prepared and deployed additional gear just for Storm Divers, available in crates around drop pod locations in Crescent Falls and Tharis lsland.

Main-Osiris-Questline-Stormdivers.name: STORM DIVERS: Lightning in a bottle
Main-Osiris-Questline-Stormdivers.description: A new and unexplained meteorological event is covering much of the surface; while Bright Sands is unaffected, Crescent Falls and Tharis Island have been covered by frequent, and lethal, storms.  Be a Stormdiver for Osiris, drop directly into an active storm, hand in Storm Diver Commissions while completing essential tasks. Osiris will ensure you're well compensated for your efforts.  Osiris has developed some unique gear for Storm Divers to use, available in crates around drop pod locations in Crescent Falls and Tharis lsland.

Acquire-Stormdivers-EventFlyers_Hint.name: Storm Divers Commissions can be found in any human Loot Container on Crescent Falls and Tharis Island during the Storm Divers Event.

Acquire-Stormdivers-HowlerSpike_Hint.name: NEEDS A PROPER HINT ONCE THE ITEM IS PLACED

Main-KOR-Stormdivers-1.description: 'You've noticed, of course, some of the strange storms over the planet now? It has made operations on Crescent Falls and Tharis Island... difficult. But no worries! Korolev is taking the lead, as always, and providing care packages with special gear for all the brave prospectors like you that drop during these conditions.  Of course... we need supplies for those. Search through Industrial Crates, you should find materials we can use in those. '

Main-KOR-Stormdivers-2.description: 'The storms haven't fazed you, eh? Good, good. Some of the others we sent down have had... issues. Many with Mature Rattlers, nasty monsters. Maybe you can lower their numbers a bit, make things easier for the rest?'

Main-KOR-Stormdivers-3.description: 'Ah, Prospector! During storms on Tharis Island and Crescent Falls, you've seen the meteors, right? I've been told they're different when they fall there, changed by the storm maybe? You must get us some samples; they might be valuable!'

Main-KOR-Stormdivers-4.description: 'Those fragments you brought back are very interesting indeed! Korolev needs more people down there, but too many that we send come back foamed... The station needs better supplies, and you can help! Search through Military Crates, always something good in those! Oh, and shoot any Heavy Striders you see, OK?'

Main-KOR-Stormdivers-5.description: 'Just who I needed! There have been reports that our latest batch of weapons have been faulty, all lies of course! I need you to set the record straight, take out some rivals using one of our superior guns!  Oh, and stash some Shock Absorbers at Greens Prospect on Crescent Falls, we need parts to repair a factory machine... You can do this quietly for us, right?'

Main-KOR-Stormdivers-6.description: 'Another prospector brought back a full Altered Meteor Core to the ICA, and they immediately became very bullish in negotiating energy fees, it can't be a coincidence! You need to bring us some of those cores, we can't lose the upper hand here! If you can't find any cores yourself, get enough Altered Meteor Fragments to combine, then bring them as soon as you can, Prospector. '

Main-KOR-Stormdivers-7.description: 'Too many beasts down there! Almost every other prospector I send down comes back encased in foam now! Get a KOMRAD and thin the heard, OK? Maybe take down some Marauders during a storm, show the other prospectors how it's done!'

Main-ICA-Stormdivers-1.description: 'Ah, hello again! The freak storms over Crescent Falls have become a problem, so much so that there's been a population boom among the more hostile fauna. Can you brave the storm and even things out for us, Prospector? And don't forget to check the care packages the ICA set near drop pod locations, they'll make your job much easier, I'm sure!'

Main-ICA-Stormdivers-2.description: 'One of our salvage crews noticed a strange organic construction, some sort of nest, maybe? Can you head down and check it out for us? Maybe the beasts on the surface are reacting to the storm by building nests? Just, bring us a sample, so we can be sure. '

Main-ICA-Stormdivers-3.description: 'This is something of a delicate matter, so some discretion is needed... Someone working for us 'misplaced' some valuables they'd be entrusted with to stash on the planet, instead spreading it around wherever they could to retrieve later. We need them back, urgently. Or at least enough similar in value; search any Safes you find and stash any Jewelry you can get your hands on at the Greens Prospect Fulfilment Center. '

Main-ICA-Stormdivers-4.description: 'Osiris has made a big show about how well their gear handles during these stormy conditions. Show them up, Prospector, let everyone know that ICA makes the best guns for Fortuna III. '

Main-ICA-Stormdivers-5.description: 'One of our scientists has been playing around with fragments from the meteors that fall over Crescent Falls and Tharis Island, saying there might be potential to use as an energy source. We'll need more Altered Meteor Fragments to confirm... and access to a locked room in the Geothermal Plant for safe testing off-station. '

Main-ICA-Stormdivers-6.description: 'Savage Marauders have been making short work of even seasoned prospectors ever since these storms started, and now some are preferring to stay in their quarters and wait it all out! Set an example, show your comrades how a real prospector handles adversity!'

Main-ICA-Stormdivers-7.description: 'Our people have had an eureka moment with the Altered Meteor Fragments you delivered! If we can get our hands on enough full cores, we might be able to rid ourselves of the yoke Korolev has over the station! But we'll also need a lot of equipment for our tests... Search any container you can find; the ICA will gladly buy whatever you bring back. And don't forget the cores! They can be rebuilt if you have enough Altered Meteor Fragments, if you can't get to any whole ones. '

Main-Osiris-Stormdivers-1.description: 'Excellent, you're here. No doubt you've noticed the wild storms over Crescent Falls and Tharis Island? An unexpected inconvenience, of course, but they present an unmissable opportunity for research! Let's start with how the new storms affect the local fauna; hunt down some Heavy Striders and bring back useful samples.  Oh, right; I had my people design a few trinkets to help you prospectors survive the storms. You should find them waiting around your drop pod in storm afflicted areas. '

Main-Osiris-Stormdivers-2.description: 'Some concerns came to my attention regarding the reliability of our armament under these new storm conditions. Reassure the station that our gear's only weakness is its operator: use Osiris weapons and cut down some creatures. And some of your upstart rivals too, to drive the message home. '

Main-Osiris-Stormdivers-3.description: 'I sent a man to Crescent Falls to perform research on-site, and he needs some equipment, so I need you to stash Biological Samplers the Greens Prospect Warehouse for them. You might have luck finding some in Medical Containers. '

Main-Osiris-Stormdivers-4.description: 'We've received reports of a new organic structure located in Crescent Falls, described as some sort of nest. These storms may have brought out a new species to the surface; I need you locate it and bring back samples for testing. '
Main-Osiris-Stormdivers-4.shortDescription: The Creature has reportedly been nesting in a Tree south of Jungle Thermal Ponds as well as on top of Nutrion Farms Processing.

Main-Osiris-Stormdivers-5.description: 'Our weapons team has been running some simulations for new flechette ammunition and need real world data, specifically under storm conditions. Take a Manticore to test against Mature Rattlers, and an ASP for Heavy Striders. And don't forget, perform the tests during a storm!'

Main-Osiris-Stormdivers-6.description: 'I take it you've seen how the meteors falling through storms are altered by it, right? Fascinating on its own, of course, but there's a similarity between the how these meteor fragments and Fortuna III's hostile fauna react to the storm that we must research further. Bring me Altered Meteor Fragments so we can begin preparations in our lab, and build up a stash of Charged Spinal Bases at the Cresecent Falls Starport Warehouse for future tests. '

Main-Osiris-Stormdivers-7.description: 'Oh, I believe you'll like this mission, Prospector. Some cretins have been spreading rumours that our energy weapons can suffer from a catastrophic feedback event because of these new storms. Lies, of course, almost definitely spread by our competitors. Put any worrywarts' minds at ease, grab a Zeus, and show how well it performs against creatures and rival prospectors alike.  Ah, and remember, the Gear Printer currently accepts Altered Meteor Cores for our top tier items, so keep an eye on the sky while you're on the surface. '

Acquire-AlienCore_Hint.name: Altered Meteor Cores can be found in Meteors during the Storm Divers Event or crafted using Altered Meteor Fragments

Main-Badum-Questline-FinalQuestline1.name: Fortuna's Favored
Main-Badum-Questline-FinalQuestline1.description: Badum's got some tough work lined up for you, but first he wants you to earn the factions' favor to be sure you're capable. He's not just some guy running a bar, after all, he keeps the peace between factions, and between prospectors.  Plus he also runs the biggest smuggling operation on Prospect Station. It's smart to have a guy like him in your corner.

Main-Badum-FinalQuestline1-1-FTUE.description: 'You want more work? I might have some tasks you can help with, but you gotta prove yourself first. Help out the Factions with some tasks and then come back to me. It takes a lot of effort to keep this place running, you know... '

Main-Badum-FinalQuestline1-2.description: 'Good job keeping the factions happy... they may have their own agendas, but the station won't make it if they just pack up and leave. Speaking of which, they've been griping that prospectors avoid some of the tougher beasts down there. Seems their own people can't handle them. So, how about you do some of the heavy lifting for them, eh?'

Main-Badum-FinalQuestline1-3.description: 'Listen up, I got a new job for you. All those old credits left on the surface? Might be locked out from the network, but they're still valid on some grey offnet circles, where the Authority can't snoop around my records. Keeping this place up and running ain't cheap, gotta bend some rules, keep some things off the books... So get me some old currency, and keep your eyes peeled for anything else worth taking!'

Main-Badum-FinalQuestline1-4.description: 'Osiris aren't the only crew interested in all this crazy planet and storm stuff. Plenty of buyers in the Artery, if you can get around the ICA's export scans or all those pansy 'hazardous materials' transport laws... Well, as I was saying; get me Charged Spinal Bases. And if you run into any Crushers or Howlers out during a storm, show them who's really the apex predator here!'

Main-Badum-FinalQuestline1-5.description: 'Been talking with some of the faction guys, see what wheels need greased, keeping tabs on their moves; pays to keep an ear to the ground, you know? Seems all three have got some big deal secret project in the works, some ace up their sleave that'll put them over the others. Can't have any more kings on this hill, so make all three projects happen. Keep them all on a level playing field. '

Main-Badum-FinalQuestline1-6.description: 'I've got my eyes on some of that new stuff that's been showing up on the station lately. The factions are being really tight fisted about it, big on their 'no sharing' policy. Kinda gets in the way of my import-export business, really. Listen, you bring me what you can, and I'll make it worth your while. '

Main-Badum-FinalQuestline1-7.description: 'K-Marks are good and all, but faction scrip is where its at. Big demand for it in the freighter adjuncts, too, if you know who to deal with. So, how about it? Get me some scrip from each faction, oughta be easy for a savvy prospector like you!'

Main-Badum-FinalQuestline1-8.description: 'There's a betting pool going, lotta money involved. Big pissing match over which faction has the best weapons, which can do the 'impossible' and give the finishing blows to three whole Alpha Crushers. How about you go for gold, do it three for three?'

Main-Badum-FinalQuestline1-9.description: 'You wanna be a legend, huh? Well, can't say you're not on your way there... Let's see if you can handle Legendary weapons, put them to good, grim use. Then come back to me, I have something special saved just for you. '

Codex_Seasons.description: <BH2>The Cycle: Frontier</> features several months' long seasons during which a Fortuna Pass is active. Prospectors can complete various tasks each day to progress in the Fortuna Pass and gain various rewards.  The time remaining in a season can be seen while in the Station and in the Fortuna Pass menu.

Codex_Fortuna.description: First settled in 2309, Fortuna III was on course to be one of the most prosperous worlds under humanity's domain, before what's known as <BH2>'The Cycle'</> upended everything half a century later, destroying the Progenitor-built Waygate orbiting the moon and cutting the Fortuna system from the rest of humanity.  As a Habitable 'Class 5' planet, Fortuna III had been terraformed tens of thousands of years by a lost civilization referred to as the Progenitors, with an ecosystem practically identical to that of other H-C5 planets, and a similar abundance of the energy-rich <BH2>Veltecite</> that fuels the Waygates connecting them. Why the Progenitors seeded these planets and then vanished isn't yet known, as the only tangible evidence of their existence are the Waygates and inert monuments that dot each planet's surface.  The planet's surface now lies practically abandoned, with only <BH2>Prospectors</> and other fools braving <BH2>The Cycle</>, and the planet's hostile fauna, to secure resources for the station in orbit.

Codex_Fortuna_Cycle.description: The Teratomorphic Energy Field, more commonly known as <BH2>'The Cycle'</>, is a hazardous radiation effect that encompasses the entire planet of Fortuna III, though there exist 'windows' that allow for humans, and their technology, to operate without suffering the worst effects.  Initially only causing delicate equipment to malfunction, each wave, found to be following a predictable cadence, increased in intensity until basic machinery failed entirely and colonists left unconscious for the duration. Less than a month after <BH2>the colonies were evacuated</> the energy field settled over the entire world, with its ebb and flow causing <BH2>terrible storms</> over the areas not fully covered by The Cycle.

Codex_Fortuna_Map1.description: Once known for its beautiful beaches, thirty years of the Cycle have made Bright Sands more resemble a marsh-filled jungle than what the old postcards depict. The area was to be the location for the Archimedes science campus, an Osiris installation focused on researching Progenitor artifacts in the region; the project was never completed, and the area now lies littered with old infrastructure and temporary support facilities.  As the first window in the Cycle to be discovered almost two decades ago, it's well mapped out and considered one of the best starting points for new prospectors to explore.

Codex_Fortuna_Map2.description: Located next to <BH2>Bright Sands</>, the large fallen Progenitor ruin at its center gave the area its name. Originally meant to support the construction and eventual operation of the nearby Archimedes science campus, the warm natural pools and rich fertile soil attracted enough interest and business to form the beginnings of a small community of its own.  Even experienced prospectors should be cautious here, as some of the fiercest creatures have make their nests in the abandoned shipping ports and overgrown facilities.

Codex_Fortuna_Map3.description: Little is known about this island, only recently available to explore after a new window in the Cycle opened up.

Codex_Fortuna_Creatures.description: Before the Cycle, Fortuna III's ecosystem featured few predators, and none considered dangerous to a well-prepared colonist. The Teratomorphic Energy Field changed all that, with monstruous creatures emerging from the unknown to savage the panicked colonists as they fled the planet's surface.   Once prospectors began braving the first windows in the Cycle a decade later, they found Fortuna III overrun with large and <BH2>highly hostile beasts</> of unnatural design. Some believe these creatures were always there, hiding under the surface; others see them as the result of constant mutations spurred by the TEF. In either case it's clear that the Cycle is to blame for their appearance, and <BH2>the Storms</> that affect the planet make these creatures even more dangerous.

Codex_Station.description: Orbiting Fortuna III, Habitat's station was never meant to house even a tenth of its current population, numbering in the hundreds of thousands. Built to be a holding area for the rich and powerful, and the system-wide HQ for several megacorps, the station became home to most of the colonists fleeing the surface, with entire freighters and other ships grafted on to it to make space for the new population.  Renamed to <BH2>'Prospect Station'</> once prospectors started dropping to the planet to bring back valuable resources, the station now serves as the hub for a system now cut off from the rest of humanity by a measure of years.

Codex_Station_QuickShop.description: Run by a former ICA boss, the <BH2>Quick Shop</> provides prospectors with <BH2>basic gear</> to keep them going. Cheap CoTEC guns, ammo, basic bags... nothing fancy, but it all works.

Codex_Station_CraftingRepairing.description: Want <BH2>better gear</>? Then check out the printing station! If you've got the right materials and enough K-Marks, the Gear Printer can handle the hard parts.  The Gear Printer is also where you'll want to go to <BH2>repair</> any damaged gear; better to reuse what you've got than buy new each time, right?

Codex_Station_LaunchingTutorial.description: The Launch Terminal overlooking Fortuna III will get you in your pod and off to whichever death trap you chose to drop to. Just don't forget to tidy your bag and check your gear before you head out!  You'll also be able to go through the <BH2>Tutorial Simulation</> again if you need a refresher, or just want to enjoy Fortuna III from the safety of orbit.

Codex_Quarters.description: You own quarters. It might not seem like much, but it's a palace compared to where most of the station populace resides. Just one of the perks of being a prospector.

Codex_Quarters_Upgrades.description: If you've got the right materials in your <BH2>Stash</>, you'll be able to <BH2>upgrade</> your Quarters to help you out in your journey to become the station's best, or richest, prospector. Increase your Stash size, passively earn Aurum and K-Marks, even improve your safe pockets' carrying space; it's worth it.

Codex_Quarters_Generators.description: The Generators will earn you a steady stream of <BH2>K-Marks</> and <BH2>Aurum</>, as well as a crate of useful stuff delivered straight to your quarters every day. Just remember to <BH2>check them regularly</> and invest in <BH2>upgrades</> to improve them!

Codex_Quarters_Deliveries.description: The Delivery Station doesn't just house your <BH2>Generators</>, of course. Had an 'accident' on the surface? Well if you took out <BH2>Insurance</>, here's where you'll find your payout. Have a special delivery from a Bundle purchased a previous season? It'll be waiting for you here. Look around, and don't forget to empty your Generators before they get too full!

Codex_Factions.description: While at its peak Fortuna III was home to dozens of massive corporations, only two remain with an active interest in the surface itself, <BH2>Korolev</> and <BH2>Osiris</>. The <BH2>ICA</>, for its part, is the civilian organization that's tasked itself with keeping Prospect Station safely in orbit and all its people alive.  If you want to get anywhere as a prospector, you'll have to <BH2>work for them</>; it's not just money they'll reward you with, but access to better and better gear, and that really makes the difference on the surface.

Codex_Factions_ICA.description: Initially meant to be only a temporary planetary civilian body to direct the colonization efforts, the <BH2>ICA</> on <BH2>Prospect Station</> came to be the de facto government for the Fortuna system after the Cycle forced the planet's evacuation. Currently its goal is just to keep the station alive and its community healthy, acting as an interface between Habitat, the official station owners, and the various <BH2>factions</> of the station, including the Prospectors that help retrieve vital resources.  The Advisory committee is made up of former colonists, station oligarchs, business representatives, and union leaders, each with their own conflicting interests, often leading to the organization having no clear goals other than the general wellbeing of the station's populace and maintaining a somewhat peaceful status quo.

Codex_Factions_Korolev.description: One of the oldest interstellar corporations, and once at the forefront of space exploration, Korolev jumped at the opportunity to set up shop a new <BH2>Veltecite-rich</> colony lost in the fringes of the galaxy.  Now that the Cycle has dashed any hopes profiting off the planet, the remaining <BH2>Korolev</> detachment supports Prospect Station with its industrial prowess, and hopes to lay claim to every bit of ore on the planet once the surface becomes safe to exploit. Assuming that ever happens, at least.

Codex_Factions_Osiris.description: Formed from the remnants of several research shops and filled with academics, <BH2>Osiris</> was left rudderless after the Cycle cut off effective communications with their parent company. While their goal of researching Progenitor artefacts and reverse engineering their technology remains the same, without access to the surface itself their work was limited to just idle theorizing.  Thankfully the corporation's newest head recognized the value prospectors could offer and is more than happy to send them off to danger for a pittance, so long as they remain effective.

Codex_Factions_MissionsJobs.description: Each faction, will offer you a series of <BH2>Missions</> that further their goals on Fortuna III; completing these won't just reward you with K-Marks and a reputation boost, but often useful kit, and more.  <BH2>Jobs</> are often more simpler tasks, the bread and butter for prospectors, getting each faction what it needs to keep itself in operation. Access to these is gated by your reputation with the faction, with the higher tier Jobs also increasing in difficulty... and rewards.

Codex_Prospecting.description: 'Prospector' is the title given to those that brave going down to the planet's surface. Initially a legal requirement for anyone putting their life at risk to mine for valuable minerals, it's now a common moniker for the 'heroes' that keep the station alive.  While the first prospectors had a life expectancy of fewer than a dozen jumps, technological advancements, courtesy of <BH2>Osiris</>, have allowed for most prospectors to survive lethal encounters thanks to the installation of emergency safety foam as a standard in all prospectors' suits  <BH2>Preparedness is the key to success.</> The life of a prospector isn't easy, but it certainly can be rewarding. Not everyone and everything you encounter will be hospitable, so you'll need the right mixture of gear depending on what you are looking to achieve on a run.  And whatever you do on the surface, <BH2>don't forget to Evac!</> Always check your Map for an accessible evac point. Remember, if you don't make it out, neither will anything you salvaged on the planet!

Codex_Prospecting_Insurance.description: The surface is a dangerous place to be, and many prospectors don't make it back on their own two feet. Your suit's stasis foam will protect you and your safe pockets, but your gear, bag, and anything in it won't be coming back to the station with you.  That's where insuring your items can help. <BH2>Standard Insurance</> works per-drop, and will get you some <BH2>K-Marks</> back on lost items if you're taken out. Eases the pain for high-risk runs, you know?  <BH2>Gear Salvage</> will cost you <BH2>Aurum</>, or an <BH2>Insurance Token</>, but it flags your gear for a bot to bring it back to the station. So long as nobody else grabs it first, you'll get the back in some time. And if someone did, you'll still get a <BH2>K-Mark</> compensation payout. The salvage flag will stick with the item no matter how many drops you take it on, until the payout triggers or you modify its attachments.  Remember to check your <BH2>Delivery Station</> in your <BH2>Quarters</> for payout; there's a limit to how many can be held for you!

Codex_Prospecting_Bags.description: While your <BH2>Safety Pockets</> may be able to carry a bit of loot around, a prospector is nothing without their trusty Bag.  The better the bag, the more weight it can carry. Be careful to not just fill it up without thinking, though, it'll get heavy, and you never know when you might need to rummage around there in an emergency.

Codex_Prospecting_Tools.description: Every prospector needs some basic tools to get the job done.  Your <BH2>Scanner</> will highlight valuable minerals in the area. You'll want to upgrade it with mods to find more valuable stuff.  The <BH2>Pickaxe</> is what you'll use to pry those minerals out. Tired of swinging it around? Then get yourself a <BH2>Mining Tool</> for faster extraction.  Visibility might be an issue on the surface. You've got a standard <BH2>Flashlight</> for when it's dark, and a pair of basic <BH2>Binoculars</> to survey an area from afar.

Codex_Prospecting_Consumables.description: <BH2>Stims</> and <BH2>Medkits</> will keep you alive on the planet; use Stims for a quick health boost, and reserve the Medkits for when you've got enough time to use them.  <BH2>Grenades</> don't just come in the big boom variety; an <BH2>Audio Decoy</> or <BH2>Smoke Grenade</> might hide your escape or aid in an ambush, while a <BH2>Gas Grenade</> will turn any area into a serious safety hazard.

Codex_Prospecting_Weapons.description: <BH2>Guns</>! You'll want to carry at least one while on the surface, because you can bet everyone else will be too. Plus there's the matter of all the alien monsters that want to make you their newest chew toy.  It's not all about rate for fire and accuracy; pay special attention to the <BH2>Penetration</> value; the higher, the more damage you'll do to Shielded prospectors and creatures with thick hides.  Want a personal touch? Most weapons can have <BH2>Mods</> attached to improve their performance or change their behaviour in just the right way.  Oh, and don't forget to take some <BH2>Ammo</> with you!

Codex_Prospecting_Armor.description: If you want to keep your insides inside, then you'll want to equip a <BH2>Shield</> vest and a <BH2>Helmet</>. The higher the <BH2>Armor</> value, the more damage it will absorb from each hit, while a higher <BH2>Durability</> keeps it, and you, intact for longer.  Don't forget to <BH2>Repair</> your damaged equipment at the <BH2>Gear Printer</>!

Codex_Aurum.description: <BH2>Aurum</> is The Cycle: Frontier's premium currency, and is mostly used for purchasing cosmetics, access to <BH2>Premium Fortuna Pass</> rewards, and <BH2>Gear Salvage Insurance</>.  While <BH2>Aurum</> can be purchased in the <BH2>Shop</> for real currency, you can also gain a steady stream of <BH2>Aurum</> by upgrading your Quarter's <BH2>Aurum Generator</>, and by unlocking free rewards in the <BH2>Fortuna Pass</>.

Codex_FortunaPass.description: <BH2>The Cycle: Frontier</> features several months' long seasons during which a Fortuna Pass is active. Each season a new <BH2>Fortuna Pass</> will become available, offering the chance to unlock free rewards for completing a number of gameplay actions, from killing hostile creatures, evaccing off the surface, or completing <BH2>Jobs</> for the <BH2>Factions</>.  You'll also be able to get access to Premium rewards, offering unique seasonal cosmetic items, by purchasing the <BH2>Premium Pass</> with <BH2>Aurum</>.  And if you're in a rush, you can put in some <BH2>Aurum</> to skip a level and immediately unlock a new reward!  The time remaining in a season can be seen while in the Station and in the Fortuna Pass menu.

Codex_VanityShop.description: Cosmetic items help you stand apart from the competition and define how you want to look on Fortuna III, but don't have any gameplay effects.  There are various types, and <BH2>any Cosmetics you unlock or purchase are tied to your account and won't be lost on the surface.</>

Codex_VanityShop_Archetypes.description: A <BH2>Prospector</> is a character archetype that allows customizing various unique looks at once, on per <BH2>Prospector</>. Each one has a unique head, and many also have unique body types and suits. Choose the one you think looks best and customize them further as you wish!

Codex_VanityShop_Character&Melee.description: Most <BH2>Prospectors</> can swap around different sets of <BH2>Boots</>, <BH2>Gloves</>, and a <BH2>Chest piece</> assuming you own the kit. Some also come with unique <BH2>Full Suits</>, a type of suit that doesn't allow further customization, but is unique to that <BH2>Prospector</>.  <BH2>Melee weapons</> can also be swapped around for each Prospector to give them a unique feel. Just note that these don't behave differently than the standard knife!

Codex_VanityShop_Weapon.description: <BH2>Weapons</> can be customized with <BH2>Skins</>, <BH2>Coatings</>, and <BH2>Charms</>.  <BH2>Skins</> are unique and tailored to specific weapons, while <BH2>Coatings</>, as well as <BH2>Charms</>, can be applied to any weapon you own.  Once you own any of these vanity types, <BH2>you can apply them to any compatible weapon in your inventory</>. If you lose a customized weapon on the surface, you'll still have access to the cosmetics for any other weapon.  Looting a weapon with cosmetics you don't own will not unlock them for you, so take care not to replace or lose something unique if you like how it looks!

Codex_VanityShop_Other.description: You can further personalize your <BH2>Prospector</> with <BH2>Sprays</> and <BH2>Banners</> to decorate Fortuna III, and <BH2>Emotes</> to show off to others what you're really thinking.

Codex_S02EventMain.description: Strange things are afoot on Fortuna III.  The <BH2>frequency of Storms</> on <BH2>Crescent Falls</> and <BH2>Tharis Island</> has tripled! The factions scratching their heads in perplexity, they must figure out what is happening down there, and how to profit off it...  The increased frequency of the storms is making it even more dangerous and difficult to send prospectors down to the surface. In a desperate move, the factions have coordinated to pool together their resources and provide <BH2>free care-packages</>, thrown down to the surface of Fortuna III alongside volunteer prospector's pods. These crates contain <BH2>makeshift storm-survival gear</> (mostly based on hastily deconstructed Progenitor tech), along with some helpful mods and consumables.  As a reward for helping out the factions in this difficult time, they're willing to give out <BH2>unique Weapon Skins</> (one per faction). This is your chance to get fancy permanent rewards and show off your participation in the event!  And that is not all! During the Event, with the help of strange <BH2>Altered Meteor Cores</> and <BH2>Fragments</> found on event maps only, prospectors will be able to craft <BH2>Epic, Exotic, and Legendary gear and weapons</> at the Gear Printer.

Codex_S02EventDuration.description: Storm Divers Event <BH2>concludes</> Season 2.  The event will last until the end of the season and the <BH2>LAST WIPE</> of The Cycle: Frontier, with the subsequent start of Season 3.

Codex_S02EventMaps.description: The increased storms happen on event maps only: <BH2>Crescent Falls</> and <BH2>Tharis Island</>.  <BH2>Bright Sands remains unaffected</>. All players who do not wish to participate in the event, or just want to take a break from it, can deploy to Bright Sands normally.  The First time user experience (FTUE) is also unaffected.  Event Maps will remain locked behind faction mission progress, so all players who want to participate in the event will need to have progressed far enough to have gained access to Crescent Falls.  Unlocking Tharis Island as well is encouraged, though not a must as all event tasks can be completed on Crescent Falls.

Codex_S02EventStormMeteors.description: <BH2>Storms</> on Crescent Falls and Tharis Island have <BH2>tripled in frequency</>.  While storms normally occurred every 40 minutes, on event maps <BH2>they will now happen every 13 minutes</>.  The duration of the Storm phase itself is not changed, but they're just as deadly!  <BH2>Meteor Showers</> on <BH2>Crescent Falls</> now also happen much more often: the next Meteor Shower can happen 5 to 10 minutes after the previous one.

Codex_S02EventPodsEvacs.description: When dropping to event maps you may sometimes make it to the surface during the Dusk, or worse, during a Storm itself!  <BH2>Evacs behave the same way as before</>, available at all times except during an active storm.  However, given the greatly increased frequency of the storms, prospectors will find it difficult or impossible to avoid a Storm while moving from a drop location to a viable evac.

Codex_S02EventCarePackage.description: When dropping to event maps, look around on exiting your drop pod!  There will be a care package lying nearby. Check it out for some <BH2>free storm protection gear, mods and consumables</> courtesy of Prospect Station's factions.  It's all yours to keep, if you can evac with it!  But keep in mind that the gear (though very handy to have in the Storm!) was hastily designed and put together, and suffers greatly reduced durability and a poor sales price.

Codex_S02EventCoresFragments.description: <BH2>Meteor Showers</> on Crescent falls bring down strange <BH2>Altered Meteor Cores</> and <BH2>Altered Meteor Fragments</>, instead of regular ones.  These unique event items will let prospectors <BH2>progress in event related faction missions</>, and, importantly, they allow for <BH2>printing powerful weapons and gear</>!  And, with the help of the station's <BH2>Gear Printer</>, it's possible to <BH2>convert Fragments into Cores</>, too!  However, meteor showers are not the only source of those valuable materials! Almost any <BH2>creature</> or <BH2>mineral vein</> on Crescent Falls and Tharis Island may produce one or more Fragments. <BH2>Creatures killed during the Storm</> will yield even more!  Additionally, the <BH2>Laser Drill</> activity and crates in the <BH2>Crystal Caverns</> will yield extra Fragments and Cores, if you're up to the challenge.  <BH2>Bright Sands remains unchanged</>; Meteor Showers still produce only regular cores and fragments. Creatures and mineral veins are also unaffected. You'll have to become the real Storm Diver on Crescent Falls and Tharis Island to enjoy these rewards!

Codex_S02EventFreeGear.description: Weapons of Epic, Exotic, and Legendary quality can now be produced at the Gear Printer using Altered Meteor Cores and Fragments.  Other Epic and Exotic gear is now printable in the same way, too, including powerful <BH2>Attachments</> and the <BH2>Oil Pump, Laser Drill, and Orbital Cannon</> beacons.

Codex_S02EventForge.description: The Forge on Tharis Island, powered by the storms, is now in overdrive mode: all forging times are reduced!  To forge any type of gear in the Forge, you'll only need x1 ingot now instead of x3 as before.  Remember that with the storms now so frequent on Tharis Island, you won't have to wait as long for the next crafting window!

Codex_S02EventSkins.description: Each faction will ask you for assistance in investigation of what's going on. Completeing the event missions will culminate in awarding you with a unique vanity item, one per faction. You can only get these during the Storm Divers event!

Codex_S02EventFlyers.description: As proof of having operated on Crescent Falls or Tharis Island, the factions will request you turn in Storm Divers Commissions.  These will can usually be found can be found in any human made container on the two event maps.  To get to the final reward from each faction you'll have to loot and turn back in a lot of these!

Codex_S02EventNests.description: There have been reports of some very strange looking organic structures appearing on Bright Sands and Crescent Falls. This might forebode something sinister for the future of Fortuna III...  The factions, as part of their event missions, may ask daredevil prospectors to go and investigate what's actually going on.

Equip_Keys_Map01_Key01.name: Server Access Key
Equip_Keys_Map01_Key01.description: Labeled only as 'Servers - Bright Sands', with the Com-Base logo.

Equip_Keys_Map01_Key02.name: Mine Access Key
Equip_Keys_Map01_Key02.description: Appears to be for one of the mine entrances along the northern edge of Bright Sands.

Equip_Keys_Map01_Key03.name: Tall House Key
Equip_Keys_Map01_Key03.description: A generic keycard, someone drew a house on stilts on the back.

Equip_Keys_Map01_Key04.name: Clean Room Key
Equip_Keys_Map01_Key04.description: Keycard carrying the 'Asclepius Vaccines' logo. And several biohazard warnings... may want to wash your hands.

Equip_Keys_Map01_Key05.name: Archaeologist's Office Key
Equip_Keys_Map01_Key05.description: Decades of swampy grime have eaten away at the keycard's cover, but someone scratched 'SKELETON' onto it with a knife. Hopefully still works.

Equip_Keys_Map01_Key06.name: Jungle Storage Room Key
Equip_Keys_Map01_Key06.description: The keycard is pretty scratched up, and might have been part of some creature's meal, but you can still see the words 'Jungle Outpost' at the top.

Equip_Keys_Map01_Key07.name: Base Camp Armory Key
Equip_Keys_Map01_Key07.description: The key is in almost pristine condition. Hopefully so are the contents of the armory it grants access to.

Equip_Keys_Map02_Key01.name: Boss' Office Key
Equip_Keys_Map02_Key01.description: The unmistakable 'STARPORT' logo leaps out from the card. The smaller 'Top Floor Admin' whispers for your attention in pitiful subscript underneath.

Equip_Keys_Map02_Key02.name: Janitor's Key
Equip_Keys_Map02_Key02.description: A janitor's key loop with a single simple key with a cute broom charm attached; it appears to longingly sweep at the floor as it dangles from your hand

Equip_Keys_Map02_Key03.name: Garage Office Key
Equip_Keys_Map02_Key03.description: The keycard has an image of one of those rad looking 6-wheeler trucks printed on it with the text 'Garage Office' alongside it.

Equip_Keys_Map02_Key04.name: Overseer's Office Key
Equip_Keys_Map02_Key04.description: Labeled with 'Nutrion Farms' and is emblazoned the Nutrion Farms logo. It's still covered in a sickly stale pumpkin juice... ew.

Equip_Keys_Map02_Key05.name: Loose House Key
Equip_Keys_Map02_Key05.description: Looks like the key to someone's house. The amount of rust and moss on it seems to imply its origin is somewhere deep in a jungle.

Equip_Keys_Map02_Key06.name: Lab Keycard
Equip_Keys_Map02_Key06.description: A bright white keycard with the telltale livery of Osiris. 'Pinnacle Labs' is laser etched professionally onto it.

Equip_Keys_Map02_Key07.name: Bar Storage Key
Equip_Keys_Map02_Key07.description: A key to The Tipsy Drone attached to a miniature trinket of the namesakes affable drone mascot.

Equip_Keys_Map02_Key08.name: Community Room Key
Equip_Keys_Map02_Key08.description: A key to what was once a more public space

Equip_Keys_Map03_Key01.name: Research Center Office Key
Equip_Keys_Map03_Key01.description: A key to the Osiris Office. Its owner sure won't be missing it...

Equip_Keys_Map02_Key09.name: Overgrown Keycard
Equip_Keys_Map02_Key09.description: A round green logo is barely visible under the muck that's grown over this keycard.

Equip_Keys_Map03_Key02.name: Korolev Quarry Building Key
Equip_Keys_Map03_Key02.description: A Key to the Korolev Quarry's Boss Office. Usually something good stashed away in such places.

Equip_Keys_Map03_Key04_AlienCorridor.name: Progenitor Corridor Key
Equip_Keys_Map03_Key04_AlienCorridor.description: Osiris discovered the schematics for this strange key amongst the Cultist Ritual Items and figured out how to use alien materials to craft it. Not meant for any human locks.

Equip_Keys_Map03_Key04_AlienCorridor_Loc.name: Can be crafted at the Gear Printer in Prospect Station using Tharis Iron and Progenitor Composite.

Equip_Keys_Map03_Key03.name: Korolev Medical Building Key
Equip_Keys_Map03_Key03.description: A Key to the Korolev Surgery Room. There must have been a lot of injuries on the island for Korolev to set one up.

Faction_FactionScreen_Korolev.description: Korolev Heavy Industries is the largest megacorp in frontier space, with a presence in every market if not an outright monopoly on most. Their kit is brutal: no bells and whistles, it works, hits hard, and takes a beating.
Faction_FactionScreen_Korolev.name: KOROLEV

Faction_FactionScreen_Osiris.description: Osiris was built up from the remains of failed and financially unviable R&D firms to perform dangerous and questionable work outside the Artery, where its owner operates under higher legal scrutiny. Osiris kit is cutting edge, geared towards speed and precision.
Faction_FactionScreen_Osiris.name: OSIRIS

Faction_FactionScreen_ICA.description: The Independent Civilian Advisory is the government where there is no government. Its mission is to represent workers and the supporting populace on colonies and stations; further the financial and political interests is just a nice bonus. ICA kit is well rounded, effective for most every situation.
Faction_FactionScreen_ICA.name: ICA

Faction_FactionScreen_Korolev_DetailedDe.name: Korolev Heavy Industries is the result of hundreds of corporations coalescing into a single massive entity over the course of two centuries, forming a practical monopoly in several markets. The megacorp operates practically everywhere humanity's managed to reach, building large scale and cheap structures along with the machines needed to build them, the myriad of tools required for life outside in frontier systems, and the ships to take them there. With heavy ties to powerful political factions on almost every major world and a market dominance only challenged by their rival CoTEC, Korolev has found itself with more money and power than it knows what to do with.  The corp's presence on Fortuna III was nothing noteworthy before the Cycle hit; the planet had cast quantities of Veltecite, as do all other Progenitor seeded planets, so they had an interest in mining claims and not just simple production. Once the Cycle hit and the the prospects of reaping the planet's resources dwindled, most Korolev personnel and its assets left for greener pastures, leaving behind a skeleton crew to ensure their claims would remain in place once (or if) the Cycle ever abated. The corp's activities on Fortuna III are overseen by Vadim Tanayev, a man with nepotism to thank for his rise in the corporate ranks, and cut-through politics for his ostracism to Fortuna III after an industrial accident at a plant he oversaw tarnished his career.  Unfortunately for Korolev, the Authority charter governing Fortuna III forbids non-scientific corporate activity on the planet. Licensed prospectors, however, are allowed on the surface at their own risk, and Korolev is keen on hiring to provide a small but steady supply of Veltecite and other resources flowing to help validate the legitimacy of their presence on Prospect Station, and ultimately, Fortuna III.  Korolev gear follows the mantra of 'it just works'. No bells and whistles, no safety features, no nonsense. Korolev items do what it says on the tin, which in most cases involve explosives. Their kit might not be geared towards mobility, opting instead for high durability and higher impact.

Faction_FactionScreen_Osiris_DetailedDes.name: A relatively young corporation, Osiris' parent company Blue Star Ltd. had a long history of buying incipient and struggling R&D and tech firms to develop and license patents to third parties. Blue Star founded Osiris from the ashes of several R&D firms, with experience in fields ranging from arms research, robotics, genetic engineering, and most notably the (now defunct) founders of the warp gates that connect the prosperous Artery systems together. As a financially and legally independent company, Osiris has been tasked to lead their research on frontier planets, with their advantage of carry less legal oversight than Artery systems, of what anything that could be the next major technological breakthrough in human history. Or just be another in a series of failed investments on the edge of space that almost invariably result in massive loss of life, one of the two.  It's current head is Emmanuel Sullivan, a visionary researcher only recently recruited by Blue Star to lead the operations on Fortuna III; between the Teratomorphic Energy Field, the unique and rapidly mutating fauna and flora, and the never-ending supply of Veltecite, the planet promises a wealth of scientific discoveries beyond imagination.  While Osiris had license to operate on the surface for research purposes, they recently started hiring Prospectors to handle the bulk of their planetary matter after several unfortunate, and costly, incidents; from now on Osiris' (remaining) field research personnel are confined to the station.  Osiris' ideals for precision and expertise are mirrored in the gear favored prospectors can acquire from them. Almost always using the latest prototype tech, the corp's gear can sometimes seem esoteric, too niche, or just too finicky, but it's brutally in the rights hands.

Faction_FactionScreen_ICA_DetailedDescri.name: The Independent Civilian Advisory is a political organization present on many permanent stations and settlements across Federal space. It exists with official recognition and support by the Federal Authority to help set up civilian institutions and associations independent from any major corporations or nations. Officially, it's a non-profit organization that answers to the Federation, and to the nation it operates under if one is present, to ensure basic needs and freedoms for the population it manages without interference by corporations. Often, it's the real government and only civilian focused organization in areas where there is no official, or effective, government.  The ICA on Prospect Station organizes several companies and businesses needed to keep the station community healthy and acts as an interface between Habitat, the official station owners, and the various factions of the station, including Prospectors and interstellar corporations. The Advisory is headed by a committee made up of former colonists, station oligarchs, business representatives, and union leaders, each with their own conflicting interests, often leading to the organization having no clear goals other than the wellbeing of the station's populace and maintaining the status quo that allows for the organization to profit off its dealings with prospectors.  While the ICA competes with other major players for the resources of Fortuna III, the organization is protected and respected on the station, where it carries out its duties without too much interference. Plus, every major company has card carrying ICA members in its workforce, something that makes overt moves against them difficult to carry out, never mind unpopular among the station's populace.  ICA gear is a mix standard kit built on station with the environment's scarce and unique resources, and custom items that borrow inspiration from those of other factions or the planet itself. Over all, ICA favors balanced and versatile, with few exceptions.

Faction_Selection_Korolev_Traits.name: Building large scale and cheap structures.  + Heavy Weapons and Armor

Faction_Selection_Osiris_Traits.name: Scientists and researchers.  + Speed and evasion

Faction_Blueprints_BPDesc_Osiris_01.name: A dependable weapon, but best used as a deterrent or last resort, rather than a primary means of defense.

Faction_Blueprints_BPDesc_Osiris_02.name: Lightweight and with an excellent firing rate, the Flechette Gun is a formidable automatic weapon for close range encounters.

Faction_Blueprints_BPDesc_Osiris_03.name: A rifle for the discerning Prospector, the Phasic Lancer features a highly accurate controlled 3-shot burst fire, effective agaist most threats a Prospector might encounter.

Faction_Blueprints_BPDesc_Osiris_04.name: Called 'Zeus' for turning any mortal into the God of Lightning, this heavy weapon will fulminate any creature that meets your divine ire.

Faction_Blueprints_BPDesc_Osiris_05.name: A targetted nanite projector that can heal near any lesion. It's also able to work on mechanical components, though with reduced efficiency than specialized equipment.

Faction_Blueprints_BPDesc_Osiris_06.name: Fires a warp point through which the operator will be transported after a few seconds, or on demand while warp point is in transit

Faction_Blueprints_BPDesc_Osiris_07.name: Allows you to Deploy a triage healing zone.

Faction_Blueprints_BPDesc_Korolev_01.name: Like most Korolev weapons, the Hammer inflicts devastating damage on its targets, at the cost of any kind of subtlety.

Faction_Blueprints_BPDesc_Korolev_02.name: Heavy and made to last, the KOR-47 has a lower firing rate than most competing weapons in its class, but its devastating 9.80mm JSP rounds messily make up the difference.

Faction_Blueprints_BPDesc_Korolev_03.name: This fearsome weapon platform is capable of firing salvos of fast-moving missiles capable of making short work of any hostile element.

Faction_Blueprints_BPDesc_Korolev_04.name: While able to neutralize heavily armored targets, the KARLA howitzer is unwieldy and suffers from a low rate of fire.

Faction_Blueprints_BPDesc_Korolev_05.name: Deploys an energy barrier that blocks movement and enemy fire, while allowing your weapon fire to pass through.

Faction_Blueprints_BPDesc_Korolev_06.name: Marks an area to be targeted by remotely launched explosives.

Faction_Blueprints_BPDesc_Korolev_07.name: Allows the user to set a recall location to which they can teleport to on demand. Useful for those wanting to get out of a difficult situation.

Faction_Blueprints_BPDesc_Korolev_08.name: Orders down a heavy automated turret that will engage any hostiles in view. Will attack any Prospector not allied with its owner.

Faction_Blueprints_BPDesc_Local_01.name: Devastating at close range, this shotgun pistol suffers from a low rate of fire and limited range.

Faction_Blueprints_BPDesc_Local_02.name: The SAR-62B 'Advocate' is a dependable weapon at close to medium range, offering a good balance between accuracy and rate of fire.

Faction_Blueprints_BPDesc_Local_03.name: A powerful semi-automatic shotgun, the crystal fragments fired by this weapon carry enough kinetic and thermal energy to defeat light armor and inflict terrible wounds.

Faction_Blueprints_BPDesc_Local_04.name: Firing a solid metal rod at immense velocity and great accuracy, this weapon is favored among Prospectors that want to resolve their differences quickly and from a safe distance.

Faction_Blueprints_BPDesc_Local_05.name: A cloaking device for your suit, it'll make you nearly invisible for a short period.

Faction_Blueprints_BPDesc_Local_06.name: An small device that will tether its victim to it's anchored location for a short duration.

Faction_Blueprints_BPDesc_Osiris_Kit_01.name: Allows for faster movement by default. Allows for quick dodges and higher jumps, as well as a combat slide.

Faction_Blueprints_BPDesc_Korolev_Kit_01.name: Gives a quickly recharging shield, a long with a high jump and a powerful melee charge attack.

Faction_Blueprints_BPDesc_Osiris_Kit_02.name: Gives a quickly recharging shield, a long with a high jump and a powerful melee charge attack.

Faction_Blueprints_BPDesc_Local_Kit_01.name: Gives the operator a short vertical boost with limited flight conrol, as well as a devastating charge attack once high enough.

Faction_Blueprints_BPDesc_Korolev_Kit_02.name: Gives the operator a quick burst of vertical speed with limited flight conrol, as well as a devastating charge attack once high enough.

Faction_Blueprints_BPDesc_Local_07.name: A simple directional scanner, this device will point out items of interest in the direction it's facing, as well as give a rough estimate on their range. Of note is that it can detect other hostile Prospectors in the area

Faction_Notification_Text.name: You've unlocked new items in Faction Shop

Gadgets_Scanner.name: Directional Scanner
Gadgets_Scanner.description: A simple directional scanner, this device will point out items of interest in the direction it's facing, as well as give a rough estimate on their range. Of note is that it can detect other hostile Prospectors in the area.
Gadgets_Scanner.lore: The fluctuating energy fields that affect H-C5.09 make most commonly used scanners ineffective, necessitating this specialized version that, while not as accurate as would be desired, does still work.

Gadgets_HealBeam.name: Kheper Revitalizer
Gadgets_HealBeam.description: Fires a beam that can heal allied prospectors and fix friendly mechanical devices. The charge canister can also be used to heal the operator when injured.
Gadgets_HealBeam.lore: The Kheper Revitalizer uses a linked-light beam to energize and guide a swarm of nanites to a target; once in proximity these quickly adapt to repair any damage before becoming inert, either becoming part of the repaired structure or turning to dust.

Gadgets_Translocator.name: Recall Teleporter
Gadgets_Translocator.description: Allows the user to set a recall location to which they can teleport to on demand. Useful for those wanting to get out of a difficult situation.
Gadgets_Translocator.lore: Designed to allow for rapid transport of goods in large factories, the Recall Teleporter has been largely deemed unsafe for use with biological matter, due to minuscule but cumulative errors in the copy and recreation process. Of course, Prospectors aren't exactly known for being risk adverse.

Gadgets_LostProspectorTranslocator.name: Lost Prospector's Recall Teleporter
Gadgets_LostProspectorTranslocator.description: A custom Recall Teleporter, will teleport the user to preset locations under certain conditions.
Gadgets_LostProspectorTranslocator.lore: Modified based on the schematics from Hector, the Lost Prospector. A lot of effort was put into making this device work and take the user to a predefined location.

Generic_Vehicle.description: A simple off-road gravbike capable of quickly carrying a prospector across the surface of Fortuna III.

Generic_ApperenceCategoryExplanation_Arc.name:
Here you can change how you're represented in the match.
This serves as the base character from which you can build on with further vanity options.

Please note that these vanity options have no gameplay effect and are purely cosmetic.

Generic_ApperenceCategoryExplanation_Ban.name: Choose which banner you want to have represent you, and plant it on the ground in-match with [{BannerKey}] to symbolize your claim.

Generic_ApperenceCategoryExplanation_Emo.name: Choose which Foam Pose to use when defeated in battle.\n\nSelect an Emote Move to taunt your enemies or just goof around by pressing [{EmoteKey}] during the match.

Generic_ApperenceCategoryExplanation_Veh.name: Choose which ride style suits you best. \n\nPlease note that these options are visual only and do not affect your ride's behavior or performance.

Generic_ApperenceCategoryExplanation_Dro.name: Choose a style for your drop pod, visible in the launch bay and your landing location. \n\nPlease note that these changes are visual only and have no gameplay effect.

Generic_ApperenceCategoryExplanation_Spr.name: Choose which spray you want to use, and paint it on surfaces with [{BannerKey}] to let everyone see.

Generic_ApperenceCategoryExplanation_Pet.name: Choose a style for your pet. \n\nPlease note that these changes are visual only and have no gameplay effect.

Generic_Tooltip_Currency_Aurum.name: Aurum can be used to purchase the Premium Fortuna Pass and cosmetics, as well as pay for Gear Salvage attempts and build timer skips.  Aurum is gained by upgrading your Quarters, through the Fortuna Pass, or purchased in the Store

Generic_Tooltip_Currency_KMark.name: K-Marks are the main currency on Fortuna Station, used to purchase all sorts of gear, Standard Insurance, build timer skips, and other services.  K-Marks are earned by working for the factions, selling items looted from the surface, and upgrading your Quarters.

Generic_Tooltip_Currency_InsruanceToken.name: Insurance Tokens pay for an item's Gear Salvage attempt, replacing its Aurum cost.  Insurance Tokens are primarily gained by progressing in the Fortuna Pass
