QuestItem_ICAWildlifePhotographerCam.name: Damaged Camera Drone
QuestItem_ICAWildlifePhotographerCam.description: A common drone used by journalists and photographers. Appears to have been in hover mode over its owner until recently.

QuestItem_ICAHowlerData1.name: Security Camera Footage
QuestItem_ICAHowlerData1.description: Data drive from a Korolev security camera. It shows a giant creature viciously attacking a pair of prospectors second after their pods landed. Given your basic knowledge of anatomy, mainly in regards to how many litres of blood an adult has in them, it seems extremely unlikely they survived.

QuestItem_ICAHowlerData2.name: Howler Combat Tips
QuestItem_ICAHowlerData2.description: A collection of 'tips' on avoiding and fighting the creature known as 'Howler'. It warns against moving when the creature 'screams', and to aim for its belly when possible. Avoiding the beast altogether is listed as the best strategy, something the tip-maker failed to do.

QuestItem_KORHowlerEvidence1.name: Howler Dossier
QuestItem_KORHowlerEvidence1.description: A dossier full of old reports and photos that place previous Howler sightings near Korolev mining sites, usually immediately after a blasting or wall breach.

QuestItem_KORHowlerEvidence2.name: Old Howler Data
QuestItem_KORHowlerEvidence2.description: A more detailed report on past Howler sighting Korolev covered. Whether or not Howler appearances were caused by Korolev mining is not confirmed, but at the time the corp certainly believed so, and went out of their way to keep all the data they collected off-network.

QuestItem_OSIHowlerClue1.name: Shredded Armor Panel
QuestItem_OSIHowlerClue1.description: Broken and mangled, with some beast's claw still lodged in it. Few creatures are able to deal this much damage. Osiris will want to analyse this.

QuestItem_OSIHowlerSample1.name: Auditory Organ
QuestItem_OSIHowlerSample1.description: Appears to be the organ the howling beasts use to echolocate targets. You're unsure why this was in one of its nests... perhaps molting? Or part of a grim mating ritual?

QuestItem_ICAAudioDecoysPlan.name: Audio Decoy Schematics
QuestItem_ICAAudioDecoysPlan.description: Schematics for a new kind of non-lethal grenade, aimed at simulating weapons fire.

QuestItem_OSIStrongStimRecipe.name: Med Stims Formula
QuestItem_OSIStrongStimRecipe.description: The recipe required to create stronger med stims. Very few of these components sound safe to ever be near living tissue.

QuestItem_OSIPaleIvySample.name: Flora Sample
QuestItem_OSIPaleIvySample.description: Sample of a flower native to Fortuna III. While this plant could theoretically survive on Bright Sands, it's very unlikely it originated from here.

QuestItem_OSICrystalCaveClue.name: Crystalline Material Research
QuestItem_OSICrystalCaveClue.description: Old Osiris research documents, focussed on a new rare crystaline structure. Likely pilfered from an Osiris research lab or lost in the evacuations, it's unlikely the research would have been carried out at the Favela.

QuestItem_Battery.name: Battery
QuestItem_Battery.description: A letium-based battery that can be used to power various machinery on Fortuna.

QuestItem_LaserDrillBeacon.name: Laser Drill Beacon
QuestItem_LaserDrillBeacon.description: A powerful locator that can be used to call down a Korolev Laser Drill Platform on Extreme Letium Veins.

QuestItem_OilPumpBeacon.name: Oil Pump Beacon
QuestItem_OilPumpBeacon.description: A powerful locator that can be used to call down an ICA NiC pump and refiner on an oil deposit.

QuestItem_AlphaWardenBait.name: Alpha Crusher Bait
QuestItem_AlphaWardenBait.description: Printed using Mutated Biomass, this bait can be used to summon an Alpha Crusher at one of its Feeding Grounds.

QuestItem_OrbitalCannonTarget.name: Orbital Cannon Beacon
QuestItem_OrbitalCannonTarget.description: Used for opening the Elite Crusher Caverns, highly charged Osiris laser gets fired at location of this beacon.

QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier1.name: Data Drive Tier 1
QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier1.description: A data drive. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks.

QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier2.name: Data Drive Tier 2
QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier2.description: A data drive with some interesting information. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks.

QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier3.name: Data Drive Tier 3
QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier3.description: A data drive with rare information. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks.

QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier4.name: Data Drive Tier 4
QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier4.description: A data drive with valuable information. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks.

QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier5.name: Data Drive Tier 5
QuestItem_HardDrive_Tier5.description: A data drive with highly valuable and unique information. Can be exchanged for K-Marks.

QuestItem_HardDrive_DigSite.name: 'Dig Site' Data Drive
QuestItem_HardDrive_DigSite.description: A data drive carrying information on the Bright Sands Dig Site.

Material_ChalniFeather.name: Chalni Feather
Material_ChalniFeather.description: Material used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.

Material_VaintarShell.name: Vaintar Shell
Material_VaintarShell.description: Material used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.

Material_Cadmium.name: Cadmium
Material_Cadmium.description: Found in various mineral veins pushed to the surface by the same process that spawns veltecite, this material is still worth selling at the station.

Material_StormSurgeCrystal.name: Storm Surge Crystal
Material_StormSurgeCrystal.description: Malformed veltecite, created when the Cycle emits a localized spike and excites latent veltecite veins underground into growing at an accelerated rate. It's definitely health hazard, but it's also worth a lot...

Material_MeteorFragment.name: Meteor Fragment
Material_MeteorFragment.description: Rare radioactive crystal, retrieved from debris of Fortuna III's cracked moon. Highly valuable.

Material_MeteorFragment_Location.name: Can be mined from meteors that fall to the surface.

Material_MeteorCore.name: Meteor Core
Material_MeteorCore.description: Rare radioactive crystal, retrieved from debris of Fortuna III's cracked moon. Extremely valuable.

Material_MeteorCore_Location.name: Can be mined from meteors that fall to the surface.

Material_Biomass.name: Mutated Biomass
Material_Biomass.description: Fortuna III's hostile creatures are already mutated versions of smaller and less aggressive ancestors, but Cycle Storms push forward rarer latent mutations. Researchers buy this stuff, as do some 'fancy' restaurants.

Material_BlueRunnerEgg.name: Blue Runner Egg
Material_BlueRunnerEgg.description: Blue Runner eggs have a notoriously thick shell, allowing them to only care for the eggs when close to hatching. Can be sold on the station.

Material_BlueRunnerEgg_Location.name: The creatures that lay these eggs often leave tracks behind. Follow them!

Material_AlphaWardenHeart.name: Alpha Crusher Heart
Material_AlphaWardenHeart.description: The heart of an Alpha Crusher, or at least chunks of it, can be used for several almost miraculous medical treatments. It's also a local delicacy, for those with more money than sense.

Material_AlphaWardenHeart_Location.name: Generally found inside Alpha Crushers. Good luck!

Material_Brightcap.name: Brightcap Mushroom
Material_Brightcap.description: Good for selling and desired by Osiris for their rare properties. Also tastes good, if prepared properly.

Material_Brightcap_Location.name: Primarily grow around the swamps and jungles of Fortuna.

Material_GlowyBrightcap.name: Glowy Brightcap Mushroom
Material_GlowyBrightcap.description: A rare glowy mushroom that can only be harvested during the storm on Fortuna. Highly coveted by Osiris.

Material_GlowyBrightcap_Location.name: Can be harvested only during the storm around the swamps and jungles of Fortuna.

Material_Nickel.name: Nickel
Material_Nickel.description: Found in various mineral veins pushed to the surface by the same process that spawns veltecite, this material is still worth mining.

Material_Nickel_Location.name: Nickel Veins be found in most areas on Fortuna. You can use a Scanner to help you find them.

Material_CommonVeltecite.name: Flawed Veltecite
Material_CommonVeltecite.description: While relatively low in value, flawed veltecite is still valuable enough to be worth taking a pickaxe to some rocks.

Material_CommonVeltecite_Location.name: Veltecite Veins can often be found around Waterfalls. A Scanner can be modded to help find them.

Material_ArdorShard.name: Cloudy Veltecite
Material_ArdorShard.description: Shards of Cloudy Veltecite are often used for energy storage and generation. Korolev are always looking for any that prospectors can mine.

Material_ArdorShard_Location.name: Veltecite Veins can often be found around Waterfalls. A Scanner can be modded to help find them.

Material_RareVeltecite.name: Clear Veltecite
Material_RareVeltecite.description: A rare shard of clear Veltecite. Korolev will pay a decent bit of pocket money for any that prospectors uncover with their pickaxes.

Material_RareVeltecite_Location.name: Veltecite Veins can often be found around Waterfalls. A Scanner can be modded to help find them.

Material_EpicVeltecite.name: Pure Veltecite
Material_EpicVeltecite.description: Very rare shard of pure Veltecite torn out of a mineral vein, highly valued by Korolev and others.

Material_EpicVeltecite_Location.name: Veltecite Veins can often be found around Waterfalls. A Scanner can be modded to help find them.

Material_GlowingCrystalCoreShard.name: Teratomorphic Crystal Core
Material_GlowingCrystalCoreShard.description: Extracted from a glowing Teratomorphic Crystal, just holding this in your bag gives you an uneasy feeling.

Material_GlowingCrystalCoreShard_Locatio.name: Can be found in the deeper caverns on Tharis Island

Material_LegendaryVeltecite.name: Veltecite Heart
Material_LegendaryVeltecite.description: The 'heart' of a veltecite vein, from which pure and common veltecite grows out of like roots reaching upwards to the surface. Incredibly rare and highly coveted.

Material_LegendaryVeltecite_Location.name: Veltecite Veins can often be found around Waterfalls. A Scanner can be modded to help find them.

Material_MagneticOre.name: Magnetite
Material_MagneticOre.description: Properly refined and treated, these ores can be used to create powerful magnets used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.

Material_MagneticOre_Location.name: Magnetite Veins can often be found in Caves and Mines. A Scanner can be modded to help find them.

Material_FocusCrystal.name: Focus Crystal
Material_FocusCrystal.description: Growths of these crystals are common on Fortuna III, valuable on the station for where they're often used in the creation of miniature figures.

Material_FocusCrystal_Location.name: Crystal Veins can often be found in the Jungles of Fortuna. A Scanner can be modded to help find them.

Material_Polonium.name: Polonium
Material_Polonium.description: Valuable glowy mineral that can only be mined during an active storm on Fortuna III

Material_PolariumCrystal.name: Polirium Crystal
Material_PolariumCrystal.description: Rare crystal, is of scientific interest and can be sold for K-Marks.

Material_PolariumCrystal_Location.name: Rare crystal found in any sort of mineral veins.

Material_DerelictExplosives.name: Derelict Explosives
Material_DerelictExplosives.description: Fortuna III's settlers took to using explosives to both mold the environment to their liking and get rid of the local pests. Can still be sold on the station, for fireworks of course.

Material_DerelictExplosives_Location.name: Can be found in Dumpsters within very high danger areas.

Material_OpticGlass.name: Optic Glass
Material_OpticGlass.description: Perfectly polished, lenses like these often find themselves used more in high-powered cutting machinery than in actual optic equipment.

Material_PowerSource.name: Power Cell
Material_PowerSource.description: Material used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.

Material_SpareCasing.name: Hardened Metals
Material_SpareCasing.description: Material used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.

Material_SpareCasing_Location.name: Can be found in any Structures and Containers.

Material_ExoNeedles.name: Howler Needles
Material_ExoNeedles.description: Material used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.

Material_NeuroToxicGlands.name: Toxic Glands
Material_NeuroToxicGlands.description: The foul smelling sack some creatures use to produce compounds capable of breaking down common synthetic materials, nevermind human flesh.

Material_NeuroToxicGlands_Location.name: Rare Drop from killed Blast Ticks and Acid Ticks.

Material_TitanOre.name: Titan Ore
Material_TitanOre.description: Somewhat common on H-C5 planets, Titan Ore was essential during the initial colonization. Still used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.

Material_TitanOre_Location.name: Titan Ore Veins can often be found in Caves and Mines. A Scanner can be modded to help find them.

Material_PolymetallicPrefabricate.name: Polymetallic Prefabricate
Material_PolymetallicPrefabricate.description: One of those 'miracle materials', sheets of this stuff is commonly used in the printing of various tools, machinery, and of course, weapons.

Material_AzureTree.name: Azure Tree Bark
Material_AzureTree.description: Azure Trees are found sprinkled around the less shaded areas of Fortuna III, with their bark coveted for artisanal goods.

Material_AzureTree_Location.name: Can be found in Coolers and at Woodcutter Camp.

Material_WinterMaterial_Event_01.name: Singing Spaceman
Material_WinterMaterial_Event_01.description: A jolly little spaceman figurine, themed after the suits used by the crew of the Starlight Song as they assisted in the rescue of Aurora Station over the planet Neptune in 2125.  Models like this would often sing short and happy songs, light up, or even dance around.

Material_UncommonModKit.name: Uncommon Mod Kit
Material_UncommonModKit.description: Uncommon mod kit description FILL IN.

Material_RareModKit.name: Rare Mod Kit
Material_RareModKit.description: Rare mod kit description FILL IN.

Material_EpicModKit.name: Epic Mod Kit
Material_EpicModKit.description: Epic mod kit description FILL IN.

Material_LegendaryModKit.name: Legendary Mod Kit
Material_LegendaryModKit.description: Legendary mod kit description FILL IN.

Material_OldCurrency.name: Old Currency
Material_OldCurrency.description: Currency used on Fortuna III before the evacuations. Still in use by some on Prospect Station.

Material_OldCurrency_Location.name: Can be found in civilian structures and belongings.

Material_DataPad.name: Interactive Screen
Material_DataPad.description: Interactive Screens were common among civilians on Fortuna III, used for all sorts of purposes. Cached data and basic components give them some selling value.

Material_DataPad_Location.name: Can be found in Briefcases and Luggage within high danger areas.

Material_MagStab.name: Magnetic Field Stabilizer
Material_MagStab.description: A component necessary for certain weapons with high power usage.

Material_AutoLoader.name: Autoloader
Material_AutoLoader.description: Used for printing a variety of equipment requiring regular charges, such as weapons.

Material_AutoLoader_Location.name: Can be found in Industrial Crates within very high danger areas.

Material_ShockAbsorber.name: Shock Absorber
Material_ShockAbsorber.description: A component used for certain weapons with heavy recoil.

Material_ShockAbsorber_Location.name: Can be found in Dumpsters. More common on harder Maps.

Material_MiniReactor.name: Miniature Reactor
Material_MiniReactor.description: Useful for printing equipment with high power requirements. DO NOT DISASSEMBLE. DO NOT ATTEMPT TO REPAIR. IF DAMAGED, DISPOSE OF AS INSTRUCTED IN FIG-24B.

Material_MiniReactor_Location.name: Can be found in the storage rooms of power facilities.

Material_CPURed.name: Master Unit CPU
Material_CPURed.description: An advanced CPU, ideal for the running of adaptive AI systems or the manipulation of complex energy fields.

Material_CPURed_Location.name: Can be found in Safes within very high danger areas.

Material_CPUBlue.name: Zero Systems CPU
Material_CPUBlue.description: Made for crunching through large datasets, used in several devices that require large amounts of simple calculations.

Material_ShardSlicer.name: Shard Slicer
Material_ShardSlicer.description: A delicate yet powerful machine used for printing certain items.

Material_ShardSlicer_Location.name: Can be found in Civilian Lockers within high danger areas. More common on harder Maps.

Material_MultiTool.name: Salvaged CoTEC MultiTool
Material_MultiTool.description: These used to be able print, repair, and manipulate simple machinery and electronics. Might still be useful if repaired or used for parts.

Material_MultiTool_Location.name: Can be found in Industrial Crates.

Material_PrintResin.name: Print Resin
Material_PrintResin.description: Can be loaded into most printers to print the base components of almost anything, from rubber ducks to weapon parts.

Material_PrintResin_Location.name: Can be found in any Structures or Containers within very high danger areas.

Material_BallBearings.name: Ball Bearings
Material_BallBearings.description: A simple mechanical component used to print a multitude of machines with moving parts, such as firearms.

Material_BallBearings_Location.name: Can be found in Dumpsters and Industrial Crates.

Material_GyroScope.name: Gyroscope
Material_GyroScope.description: Helps keep things pointing where they're supposed to be pointing even in the roughest conditions, making it quite useful for printing some weapon components.

Material_GyroScope_Location.name: Can be found in Cabinets within high danger areas.

Material_HydraulicPiston.name: Hydraulic Piston
Material_HydraulicPiston.description: Useful for printing weapons and beacons. The tech may be hundreds of years old, but if it works, it works.

Material_HydraulicPiston_Location.name: Can be found in Industrial Crates.

Material_CompoundSheets.name: Compound Sheets
Material_CompoundSheets.description: Standardized metal and plastic sheets like these are used to print everything from tractors to weapons, so long as you follow the right printing instructions.

Material_CompoundSheets_Location.name: Can be found in any Structures and Containers.

Material_Alloys.name: Metallic Alloys
Material_Alloys.description: A collection of metal alloys used as a base material in many items, ready to slot into compatible printers.

Material_Alloys_Location.name: Can be found in Dumpsters and Industrial Crates.

Material_CreatureClaw.name: Sharp Claw
Material_CreatureClaw.description: Hard and sharp, claws like these are capable of piercing a prospector's defenses and rip their flesh apart with ease.

Material_CreatureClaw_Location.name: Obtained from killing hostile Fortuna III creatures.

Material_CrusherTongue.name: Crusher Tongue
Material_CrusherTongue.description: Tough and slimy, the tongue's secretions have a variety of uses if refined, and the flesh itself is considered a delicacy if prepared correctly.

Material_CrusherTongue_Location.name: Obtained from killing Crushers on Fortuna III's surface.

Material_AlphaCrusherSkull.name: Alpha Crusher Skull
Material_AlphaCrusherSkull.description: It doesn't seem to have any real practical purpose, but this trophy is one of the most desired items Fortuna III produces.

Material_AlphaCrusherSkull_Location.name: Obtained from killing Alpha Crushers on Fortuna III's surface. Good luck!

Material_GenericCreatureDrop.name: Spinal Base
Material_GenericCreatureDrop.description: Wanted for several rare materials easily harvested from the spine, as well as for research by those looking into the origins of Fortuna III's hostile creatures.

Material_GenericCreatureDrop_Location.name: Obtained by killing Striders on Fortuna III.

Material_StormyCreatureDrop.name: Charged Spinal Base
Material_StormyCreatureDrop.description: The base of the spine of a hostile Fortuna III creature affected by the Cycle. Contains some useful materials for various items or research.

Material_StormyCreatureDrop_Location.name: Obtained by killing hostile creatures during an active storm.

Material_HardenedBoneAlloy.name: Hardened Bone Plates
Material_HardenedBoneAlloy.description: Dropped from some of Fortuna III's toughest creatures, can be used for printing certain items after refining.

Material_FlakedLethium.name: Letium Clot
Material_FlakedLethium.description: Solidified mass of Letium, rare and valuable.

Material_FlakedLethium_Location.name: Obtained by using a Korolev Laser Drill to drill a Letium Deposit.

Material_OilTank.name: NiC Oil Canister
Material_OilTank.description: A pressured canister filled with concentrated Nanite-infused Crude. It reacts to the storm radiation in strange ways.  Almost looks like it's alive, moving and swirling on its own.

Material_OilTank_Location.name: Can be extracted from an exposed Oil Well using an ICA Oil Pump.

Material_PureNickel.name: Altered Nickel
Material_PureNickel.description: Found in various mineral veins pushed to the surface by the same process that spawns veltecite, this ore seems to have been affected by proximity with the rare crystals.

Material_PureNickel_Location.name: Nickel Veins can be found in most areas on Fortuna. A Scanner can help find them.

Material_BrittleTitanOre.name: Brittle Titan Ore
Material_BrittleTitanOre.description: Somewhat common on H-C5 planets, Titan Ore was essential during the initial colonization. Still used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.

Material_BrittleTitanOre_Location.name: Titan Ore Veins can often be found in Caves and Mines. A Scanner can be modded to help find them.

Material_PureFocusCrystal.name: Pure Focus Crystal
Material_PureFocusCrystal.description: Growths of these crystals are common on Fortuna III, valuable on the station for where they're often used in the creation of miniature figures.

Material_PureFocusCrystal_Location.name: Crystal Veins can often be found in the Jungles of Fortuna. A Scanner can be modded to help find them.

Material_WaterPlant.name: Waterweed Filament
Material_WaterPlant.description: The pollen filament of a Waterweed, a plant that can only be harvested around water bodies such as lakes or swamps on Fortuna III. The blossoms themselves are worthless, but these Filaments fetch a decent price on Prospect Station.

Material_WaterPlant_Location.name: Grows around Lakes and other still waters such as the Rock Pools on the Bright Sands Map.

Material_DesertPlant.name: Dustbloom
Material_DesertPlant.description: This lonely weed grows in open, arid areas on Fortuna III and develops valuable vibrant blossoms when exposed to direct sunlight.

Material_DesertPlant_Location.name: Flourishes in open, arid areas of Fortuna.

Material_IvyPlant.name: Pale Ivy Blossom
Material_IvyPlant.description: The blossom of Pale Ivy, a strange plant that likes to climb up walls to keep its gorgeous, divinely smelling petals out of the reach of critters and insects.

Material_IvyPlant_Location.name: Likes to grow on walls and cliffs in overgrown areas.

Material_Alien Fruit.name: Indigenous Fruit
Material_Alien Fruit.description: Tastes delicious, and can be processed to gain some useful chemicals.

Material_Fabrics.name: Textiles
Material_Fabrics.description: Heavy and durable fabrics, useful for printing various items.  You can never get the smell of mildew out of these.

Material_Fabrics_Location.name: Can be found in Civilian Lockers.

Material_Cables.name: Electronic Cables
Material_Cables.description: A bundle of cables, still in good condition.  Unfortunately not platinum plated, unsuitable for true audio transmission.

Material_Insulation.name: Salvaged Insulation
Material_Insulation.description: Even outside of its intended purpose, the materials still have various uses in item printing.  Yes, it's asbestos.

Material_Insulation_Location.name: Can be found in any Structures and Containers.

Material_Copper Wire.name: Copper Wire
Material_Copper Wire.description: Still the best bang for the buck for electric cables, makes for a good and cheap electric conductor.

Material_Smart mesh.name: Smart Mesh
Material_Smart mesh.description: Adaptable material, used for printing various items.  Also a fun art tool!

Material_Smart mesh_Location.name: Can be found in Dumpsters and Industrial Crates within high danger areas.

Material_Circuit Board.name: Circuit Board
Material_Circuit Board.description: An old circuit board, its components can be salvaged and repurposed to build new items.  And now you can put e-waste management on your resume.

Material_Circuit Board_Location.name: Can be found in Briefcases and Luggage.

Material_Adhesive.name: Resin Gun
Material_Adhesive.description: Multi purpose tool, handy for sticking things together or providing flexible insulation.  The warning label says to not use if you need a warning label.

Material_Adhesive_Location.name: Can be found in Coolers and Civilian Lockers. More common on harder Maps.

Material_RadioSpareParts.name: Radio Equipment
Material_RadioSpareParts.description: An old colonial radio transceiver; salvaging these for item printing is cheaper than buying new parts.

Material_RadioSpareParts_Location.name: Can be found in Briefcases and Luggage.

Material_Antibiotics.name: Old Medicine
Material_Antibiotics.description: Medicine left behind on the planet, can be processed to make new supplies.  Fortuna's colonists definitely had a lot of pills...

Material_Antibiotics_Location.name: Can be found in Medical Cases.

Material_PortableLabEquipmentBox.name: Portable Lab
Material_PortableLabEquipmentBox.description: A full lab in a box, also contains all sorts of specialized equipment and materials that can be repurposed.  Loaded with delicate tools, sensitive software, and no manual.

Material_PortableLabEquipmentBox_Locatio.name: Can be found in Cabinets within very high danger areas.

Material_Battery.name: 'Fusion Cartridge' Batteries
Material_Battery.description: A pack of high-powered, slightly radioactive batteries. Safe to use in most electronic devices.  Not actually fusion powered, but still worryingly radioactive.

Material_Battery_Location.name: Can be found in Civilian Lockers.

Material_LiquidFertilizer.name: 'Magic-GROW' Fertilizer
Material_LiquidFertilizer.description: A powerful and sweet smelling chemical, can be processed to help manufacture other items.  Don't ingest within 6 hours of consuming any fruits or nuts. Or ideally ever.

Material_SamplingDevice.name: Biological Sampler
Material_SamplingDevice.description: A portable device used for collecting biological samples in the field. Can be used to assist with printing delicate items.  This model incorporates a pressure-activated injector as well. Mildly concerning.

Material_SamplingDevice_Location.name: Can be found in Medical Cases.

Material_AnaestheticsContainers.name: Medical Supplies
Material_AnaestheticsContainers.description: A small crate of miscellaneous medical supplies, has all sorts of chemicals useful for printing new items.  There are A LOT of warning labels here.

Material_AnaestheticsContainers_Location.name: Can be found in Medical Cases.

Material_ProteinBar.name: Nutritional Bar
Material_ProteinBar.description: Nutrion's flagship product, a full day's meal in a single candy bar.

Material_ProteinBar_Location.name: Can be found in Coolers and Civilian Lockers within high danger areas.

Material_Jewellery.name: Jewellery
Material_Jewellery.description: A simple and easy way to carry one's riches and memories.  Also very easy to lose during an emergency evacuation.

Material_SampleContainer.name: Sample Container
Material_SampleContainer.description: A sealed self-powered container for exotic alien samples.  Scientists are always putting little things in jars and hoping for the best.

Material_SampleContainer_Location.name: Can be found in Coolers and Civilian Lockers. More common on harder Maps.

Material_AluminumParts.name: Aluminum Scrap
Material_AluminumParts.description: Mostly aluminum and steel; not the most valuable salvage, but useful for printing.

Material_AluminumParts_Location.name: Can be found in any Structures and Containers within high danger areas.

Material_ForgeIron.name: Tharis Iron
Material_ForgeIron.description: A solid clump of inert ancient nanites fused with iron, along with various other elements trapped within when the mass solidified.

Material_ForgeIron_Location.name: Can only be mined in the dark depths of the Tharis Caverns.

Material_PureForgeIron.name: Pure Tharis Iron
Material_PureForgeIron.description: A small mass of inert nanites mixed with elemental iron and few other metals. The composite structure is almost perfect.

Material_PureForgeIron_Location.name: Can only be mined in the dark depths of the Tharis Caverns.

Material_ForgeIronIngot.name: Tharis Iron Ingot
Material_ForgeIronIngot.description: A well shaped ingot made with Tharis Iron. Harder and heavier than anything else you have ever felt. Slightly warm to the touch.

Material_ForgeIronIngot_Location.name: No human machinery could ever forge something like this.

Material_ChargedForgeIronIngot.name: Charged Tharis Iron Ingot
Material_ChargedForgeIronIngot.description: An ingot made of Pure Tharis Iron somehow charged with storm lightning. Sometimes lets off a shock when touched, and you can hear a buzz if you put it next to your ear.  OSIRIS ADVISORY: Do not any under circumstances interact with this material without Class T protective gear!

Material_ChargedForgeIronIngot_Location.name: No human machine could have forged something like this.

Material_SuperChargedForgeIronIngot.name: Super Charged Tharis Iron Ingot
Material_SuperChargedForgeIronIngot.description: An ingot made of Pure Tharis Iron, heavily charged with storm lightning. Just touching it leaves your fingers numb.  OSIRIS ADVISORY: Do not any under circumstances interact with this material without Class T protective gear!

Material_SuperChargedForgeIronIngot_Loca.name: No human machine could have forged something like this.

Material_StriderHead.name: Strider Head
Material_StriderHead.description: The torn off head of a dead Strider.  Careful, it can still bite!

Material_StriderHead_Location.name: Generally found on Striders. More common during active Storms.

Material_StriderHead_03.name: Heavy Strider Head
Material_StriderHead_03.description: The torn off head of a dead Heavy Strider.  Far too ugly to mount on a wall.

Material_StriderHead_03_Location.name: Can be found on Heavy Striders.

Material_RattlerHead.name: Rattler Head
Material_RattlerHead.description: The torn off head of a dead Rattler.  Corrosive drool everywhere, handle with gloves.

Material_RattlerHead_Location.name: Often found in the vicinity of a Rattler. More common during active Storms.

Material_RattlerHead_02.name: Mature Rattler Head
Material_RattlerHead_02.description: The torn off head of a dead Mature Rattler.  These things do NOT age gracefully...

Material_RattlerHead_02_Location.name: Mature Rattlers tend to have these. More common during active Storms.

Material_WeremoleHead.name: Marauder Head
Material_WeremoleHead.description: The torn off head of a dead Marauder.  The eyes still follow you around. Creepy.

Material_WeremoleHead_Location.name: Often located on a Marauder. More common during active Storms.

Material_WeremoleHead_02.name: Savage Marauder Head
Material_WeremoleHead_02.description: The torn off head of a dead Savage Marauder.  It's still blinking. Menacingly.

Material_WeremoleHead_02_Location.name: Savage Marauders sometimes lose these. More common during active Storms.

Material_CrusherHead.name: Crusher Head
Material_CrusherHead.description: The torn off head of a dead Crusher.  It's even uglier up close... Still, a fine trophy!

Material_CrusherHead_Location.name: Can generally be found by first locating a Crusher.  More common during active Storms.

Material_StriderMeat.name: Strider Flesh
Material_StriderMeat.description: A chunk of Strider flesh. Presumably of a dead one.  You know, if you cook it properly it's actually pretty good.

Material_StriderMeat_3.name: Heavy Strider Flesh
Material_StriderMeat_3.description: A chunk of flesh from a Heavy Strider.  Tougher than normal Strider meat, it barely bleeds.

Material_RattlerEyes.name: Rattler Eyes
Material_RattlerEyes.description: The eyes of a dead Rattler.  Well, hopefully it was dead, anyway...

Material_RattlerEyes_Location.name: Can be plucked out of a dead Rattler.

Material_RattlerEyes_2.name: Mature Rattler Eyes
Material_RattlerEyes_2.description: The eyes of a dead Mature Rattler.  Age only improved the thing's sight...

Material_RattlerEyes_2_Location.name: Tend to come from dead Mature Rattlers.

Material_WeremoleMeat.name: Marauder Flesh
Material_WeremoleMeat.description: A chunk of Marauder flesh.  It moves if you poke it.

Material_WeremoleMeat_Location.name: Generally found after a Marauder finds you. What happens next is an adventure!

Material_WeremoleMeat_2.name: Savage Marauder Flesh
Material_WeremoleMeat_2.description: A chunk of Savage Marauder flesh.  Burns if you touch it without gloves.

Material_CrusherMeat.name: Crusher Flesh
Material_CrusherMeat.description: A chunk of Crusher flesh.  Even its meat is hard as bone.

Material_CrusherMeat_Location.name: Commonly found on a dead Crusher.

Material_RattlerSkin.name: Rattler Skin
Material_RattlerSkin.description: Taken off a skinned Rattler.  Fashionable! Just don't think about where it came from.

Material_CrusherSkin.name: Crusher Hide
Material_CrusherSkin.description: Taken off a skinned Crusher.  (read: hacked repeatedly until something fell off)

Material_AF_Slag.name: Progenitor Slag
Material_AF_Slag.description: Refuse from some unknown process. Not very useful, but still fetches a high price on the station by alien artefact collectors and admirers of rare art.

Material_AF_Slag_Location.name: Sometimes carried by prospectors that ventured into the Tharis caverns.

Material_AF_Token.name: Abyss Alloy
Material_AF_Token.description: A sphere of processed and activated Tharis Iron impossibly locked in place.   Gives an aura of infinite potential.

Material_AF_Token_Location.name: Rumor has it that it can be found in the depths of Tharis Caverns

Material_AlienPlant.name: Spine Briar
Material_AlienPlant.description: A unique plant so far only found on Tharis Island. Nothing about it feels right...

Material_AlienPlant_Location.name: Can be found in the depths of the Tharis Caverns

Material_AlienScrap.name: Progenitor Composite
Material_AlienScrap.description: A clearly alien material, the Progenitors built their monuments on Fortuna III with this. Could possibly be used to build other things, as well.

Material_AlienScrap_Location.name: Rumor has it that it can be found in the depths of the Tharis Caverns

QuestItem_KorolevScrip.name: Korolev Scrip
QuestItem_KorolevScrip.description: Rewarded by Korolev, required for upgrades to your Quarters' Stash and Safe Pockets.

QuestItem_KorolevScrip_Location.name: Obtained by completing Missions and Jobs for Korolev

QuestItem_OsirisScrip.name: Osiris Scrip
QuestItem_OsirisScrip.description: Rewarded by Osiris, required for upgrades to your Quarters' K-Mark and Aurum generators.

QuestItem_OsirisScrip_Location.name: Obtained by completing Missions and Jobs for Osiris

QuestItem_ICAScrip.name: ICA Scrip
QuestItem_ICAScrip.description: Rewarded by the ICA, required for upgrades to your Quarters' Supply Crate Generator and Gear Printer.

QuestItem_ICAScrip_Location.name: Obtained by completing Missions and Jobs for the ICA

MissionItem_MinerItem1.name: Miner Cam #2F53
MissionItem_MinerItem1.description: Camera belonging to a 'Jamie Faulkner'. The last video file is damaged, but the audio is of a large crowd demanding to be let in' before suddenly cutting off. '

MissionItem_MinerItem2.name: Miner Cam #D027
MissionItem_MinerItem2.description: Owner named only as 'Temporary'. Last video shows several workers running out barricaded buildings and towards a clearing with a guarded ship being loaded with ore. Video cuts off after the owner appears to trip and fall.

MissionItem_MinerItem3.name: Miner Cam #A45D
MissionItem_MinerItem3.description: Camera belonging to a 'Mayumi S. Nagao'. Video shows her being pushed out of a cargo ship by a Korolev Heavy Trooper and falling into the mud. Video cuts off shortly after an eruption of gunfire is heard around her.

MissionItem_EngineerItem.name: Letium Coated Helmet
MissionItem_EngineerItem.description: An engineer's helmet caked in Letium. The embedded sensors may have recorded something important.

MissionItem_CreatureSample.name: Letium Bio Samples
MissionItem_CreatureSample.description: A container preserving... something. A label on the side states: 'WARNING: HIGH LETIUM CONTENT, DO NOT SHAKE'

MissionItem_LaserDrillPart.name: Laser Drill Control Unit
MissionItem_LaserDrillPart.description: Part of the system that manages the Drill. Hopefully it can be reconfigured to safely mine for Letium.

MissionItem_ICAPersonalItem.name: Sign of Life from Stranded Prospector
MissionItem_ICAPersonalItem.description: A photo of Marie and a prospector named Tao. Rare to see paper photographs anymore, it must have meant a lot to the owner.

MissionItem_PowerPlantItem1.name: Notes on Meteor Experiment - 1
MissionItem_PowerPlantItem1.description: Personal data tablet with theoretical research on powering energy generators with fragments from Fortuna's moon. The power output of a single working 'Fireball generator would be revolutionary. '

MissionItem_PowerPlantItem2.name: Notes on Meteor Experiment - 2
MissionItem_PowerPlantItem2.description: Data on the first prototype for 'Project Fireball'. Yields under safe conditions were underwhelming, with warnings of an uncontrollable chain reaction if pushed too hard without further research. Might explain why there's a giant hole in the moon...  Final notes suggest switching resources to look into 'NiC'.

MissionItem_OilPumpPart.name: Oil Pump Part
MissionItem_OilPumpPart.description: One of the few remaining components from an old oil pump that still looks to be in working condition.

MissionItem_OldBones.name: Old Bones
MissionItem_OldBones.description: Belonging to a long dead creature, damage has exposed metalic elements that seemed to have formed after death.

MissionItem_AlphaSkull.name: Warden Tooth
MissionItem_AlphaSkull.description: The tooth of a now extinct massive beast once common on Fortuna III. Parts of it seem to have unnatural grooves and geometric shapes.

MissionItem_FlightRecorder.name: Flight Recorder
MissionItem_FlightRecorder.description: A cargo ship's flight recorder, only slightly damaged. Highly encrypted and beyond your suit's ability to access.

MissionItem_Notebook.name: Old Notebook
MissionItem_Notebook.description: An Osiris researcher's notebook. It's seen better days. Full of formulas, drawings, and long paragraphs regarding the unnatural evolution and mutations of Fortuna III's fauna caused by Progenitor terraformers.

MissionItem_KorChiefEngineerDiary.name: Chief Engineer's Personal Diary
MissionItem_KorChiefEngineerDiary.description: An off the record log of some of the events that occurred on Tharis island. While badly damaged, and much of it is in short hand, what's evident is Korolev ran into serious issues in the caverns: several reports of miners going missing, pervasive malaise, multiple accidents...  The operation's foreman clearly had little regard for workplace safety.

MissionItem_ForgeIronSample.name: Tharis Iron Sample
MissionItem_ForgeIronSample.description: A collected sample of a rare composite material found in the Tharis Caverns

MissionItem_PureForgeIronNugget.name: Pure Tharis Iron Nugget
MissionItem_PureForgeIronNugget.description: A tagged nugget of a rare composite material found in the Tharis Caverns. Denser and with next to no impurities than most samples.

MissionItem_MiningPartyMedicalFiles.name: Mining Party Medical Files
MissionItem_MiningPartyMedicalFiles.description: A collection of medical reports from the Korolev team working the caverns. Initial incidents involved exhaustion and minor injuries, but later reports focus on mental clouding, hallucinations, loss of time...  Symptoms appear identical to those of prolonged exposure to the Teratomorphic Energy Field that now envelops most of Fortuna III.

MissionItem_VadimPredecessorItem.name: The Tharis Files
MissionItem_VadimPredecessorItem.description: A folder kept by Gregor Kazan, the Head of Operations for Korolev when the storms hit Fortuna III decades ago. It appears he intentionally kept all reports and findings from the Tharis operations off the system, though the reason for that isn't explained, nor is how the folder ended up on the island.  Worryingly, official records state less than 50 Korolev employees ever worked in the caverns, while these files list several hundred.

MissionItem_StolenKorData1.name: Korolev Data Drive #473-D
MissionItem_StolenKorData1.description: A chunky old data drive. Might have some valuable info, if it still works.

MissionItem_StolenKorData2.name: Korolev Notes
MissionItem_StolenKorData2.description: A Korolev data drive. Appears to have been used as a blunt instrument. Has definitely seen better days.

MissionItem_CultistGlowCrystalItem.name: Mysterious Glowing Contraption
MissionItem_CultistGlowCrystalItem.description: A crystaline chunk with various cables and circuit boards haphazardly strapped on to it.  It's impossible to tell if the mind that created this had something utilitarian in mind, or if this creation is simply a form of religious 'art'.

MissionItem_CultistRitualItem.name: Cultist Ritual Item
MissionItem_CultistRitualItem.description: Some sort of cultist fetish, featuring a clump of Tharis Iron and a sigil or diagram of some kind. Maybe they venerated the alien material? Or it's just a symbol for the caverns themselves?

MissionItem_AlienShieldRecipe.name: Cultist Scribblings
MissionItem_AlienShieldRecipe.description: An old sheet of paper with various drawings and pictograms laid out as simple formulas, all but one scratched out.  The same trident-like drawing found on previous cultist items features prominently here.

MissionItem_ColonistItem.name: Colonist Item
MissionItem_ColonistItem.description: An old mini-comm and some personal items. Whoever this belonged to likely didn't work on the island.

MissionItem_StolenOsiHoloMap.name: Tharis Caverns Holo-Map
MissionItem_StolenOsiHoloMap.description: A map liberated from an abandoned Osiris outpost. Shows the layout of the Tharis caverns, including several areas marked as high-interest.

MissionItem_KorCivilianItem.name: Vintage Camera
MissionItem_KorCivilianItem.description: An ancient video recording device, probably fashionable in some retro circles. Amazingly it actually powered on, though only for a few seconds.

MissionItem_AlienDoorFragment.name: Osiris Door Fragment
MissionItem_AlienDoorFragment.description: A loose bit from the strange door in one of the Osiris installations on Tharis Island.  The door itself seems impenetrable, far more robust than what Osiris is known for building.

MissionItem_AnalysisTool.name: Advanced Analysis Toolkit
MissionItem_AnalysisTool.description: An old Osiris portable lab, still in working condition. Surely nobody will mind giving it a new home and purpose...

MissionItem_OsiChiefEngineerItem.name: Osiris Engineer Scanner
MissionItem_OsiChiefEngineerItem.description: Recovered off the body of an Osiris engineer in Tharis Caverns, appears to have been mapping out potential research locations when they met with a terrible fate.

MissionItem_OsiHeadScientistItem.name: Osiris Helmet Recorder
MissionItem_OsiHeadScientistItem.description: A damaged Osiris researcher helmet, these always carry their own camera and data storage.  Fortunately, whatever it was that did short work of its wearer managed to avoid breaking any of the valuable bits.

Event_StormDiversFlyer.name: Storm Divers Commission
Event_StormDiversFlyer.description: Official document issued to prospectors that drop onto Crescent Falls or Tharis Island as a Storm Diver. Required to hand in to the factions for certain missions as proof of participation.  Warning: Storms on Crescent Falls and Tharis Island have a dramatically increased frequency and intensity. Use extreme caution when dropping to these areas, and don't hesitate to make use of the gear granted by the factions in crates placed around your drop pod.

Event_StormDiversFlyer_Location.name: Found in Storm Diver crates prospectors have access to outside their drop pods as well as any other containers on Crescent Falls and Tharis during the Storm Divers Event.

Event_MeteorCore.name: Altered Meteor Core
Event_MeteorCore.description: Core of a meteor from Fortuna III's cracked moon. Its path through the strange storms over the planet have altered it somehow.  Can be used for printing high-tier gear.

Event_MeteorCore_Location.name: Can be mined from meteors that fall onto Crescent Falls. Can be constructed at the Gear Printer using multiple Altered Meteor Fragments.

Event_MeteorFragment.name: Altered Meteor Fragment
Event_MeteorFragment.description: Fragment of a meteor from Fortuna III's cracked moon. Its path through the strange storms over the planet have altered it somehow.  Can be used at the gear printer. Multiple Fragments can be used to create an Altered Meteor Core.

Event_MeteorFragment_Location.name: Can be mined from meteors that fall onto Crescent Falls, and occasionally dropped by creatures on Crescent Falls and Tharis Island.

Event_StormdiversHowlerSpike.name: Spike from an Unknown Creature
Event_StormdiversHowlerSpike.description: A very dangerous-looking Spike, left behind by a strange new Creature that seems to have appeared on Fortuna. Be on your guard.

Material_AI_HowlerDart.name: Howler Dart
Material_AI_HowlerDart.description: One of the deadly projectiles Howlers use to skewer prey from a distance. This one was still not fully formed and can be harvested for useful materials. Worth some coin to the right people.

Material_AI_HowlerDart_Location.name: Occasionally dropped by dead Howlers. More common during active Storms.

Material_AI_HowlerGland_01.name: Howler Ichor Gland
Material_AI_HowlerGland_01.description: A damaged gland ripped out of a dead Howler. Used by the creatures to excrete several compounds and pheromones, commonly referred to as 'honey'; the organ alone is in high demand.

Material_AI_HowlerGland_01_Location.name: Can sometimes be found on dead Howlers.

Material_AI_HowlerGland_02.name: Inflamed Howler Ichor Gland
Material_AI_HowlerGland_02.description: Known as the 'Honey Gland', this organ is still capable of producing some of the valued honey-like substance Howlers use to attract and dominate other creatures. Very valuable.

Material_AI_HowlerGland_02_Location.name: Can be ripped out of of dead Howlers, if you're lucky.

Material_AI_HowlerSyrinx_01.name: Damaged Howler Syrinx
Material_AI_HowlerSyrinx_01.description: Effectively the 'vocal cords' that Howlers use to emit their iconic screams. Reaches a high price on the station.

Material_AI_HowlerSyrinx_01_Location.name: Rarely dropped by dead Howlers. More common during active Storms.

Material_AI_HowlerSyrinx_02.name: Intact Howler Syrinx
Material_AI_HowlerSyrinx_02.description: The sound emitting organ of a dead Howler, removed in one whole neat piece. The intricacies of its 'construction' make it very valuable.

Material_AI_HowlerSyrinx_02_Location.name: Very rarey found on dead Howlers.

Material_AI_HowlerPellet.name: Howler Ichor Bulb
Material_AI_HowlerPellet.description: An encased glob of Howler 'honey', the sticky substance the creatures use to affect other creatures, and as sustenance for their young. It's been found to be highly nutritious, sweet, and have almost mythical regenerative properties. Of course, it's also extremely addictive with a lethal withdrawal.

Material_AI_HowlerPellet_Location.name: Can be found in Howler nests.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_01_Message.name: So, you want to be a prospector?  Well first thing's first, head to any one of the three faction HQs and pick up a Contract; that'll get your name on the work roster and give you your first task on the surface. Don't worry about which faction you start with, you can take work from any of them at any time later on.  Come back when you've got a Contract, I'll get you started with some spare gear.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_01_Subject.name: Talk to Badum at The Lucky Leafman Bar

MS_Onboarding_Intro_02_Message.name: All that free new gear won't help you if you don't equip it. Open your Inventory to check what you have.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_02_Subject.name: Press <inputAction light=true name=OpenMatchInventory/> and access your <B1>Inventory</>

MS_Onboarding_Intro_03_Message.name: OK, you're all set. Head to the Launch Terminal. From there you can start your first drop onto Fortuna III.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_04_Message.name: You made it back in one piece! Never expected less, of course.  Next up, you should check the different factions' contract boards, those guys could use somebody like you. And don't forget to turn your loot into money at the faction vendors!

MS_Onboarding_Intro_04_Subject.name: Go to the three Faction leaders and accept a mission from each

MS_Onboarding_Intro_TalkToBadum_01.name: Talk to Badum at The Lucky Leafman Bar

MS_Onboarding_Intro_TalkToBadum_02.name: Speak with the Faction leader of Osiris and accept their mission

MS_Onboarding_Intro_TalkToBadum_03.name: Talk to Badum and claim your welcome package

MS_Onboarding_FeatureBlocked_WeaponPurch.name: Finish Badum's tasks to unlock this feature.

MS_Onboarding_FeatureBlocked_Contracts_B.name: Finish Badum's tasks to unlock this feature.

MS_Onboarding_FeatureBlocked_PlayMatch_B.name: Finish Badum's tasks to unlock this feature.

MS_Onboarding_FeatureBlocked_Techtree_Bo.name: Finish Badum's tasks to unlock this feature.

MS_Onboarding_FeatureBlocked_Generators_.name: Finish Badum's tasks to unlock this feature.

MS_Onboarding_FeatureBlocked_CraftingSta.name: Finish Badum's tasks to unlock this feature.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_OpenStash_01.name: Press <inputAction light=true name=OpenMatchInventory/> to open the <B1>inventory</>

MS_Onboarding_Intro_OpenStash_02.name: Drag a backpack into the backpack slot

MS_Onboarding_Intro_OpenStash_03.name: Drag a weapon into a weapon slot

MS_Onboarding_Intro_OpenStash_04.name: Drag ammo for your weapon into your backpack

MS_Onboarding_Intro_OpenStash_05.name: Drag a consumable into your backpack

MS_Onboarding_Intro_OpenStash_06.name: Drag a shield into the Shield Slot

MS_Onboarding_Intro_OpenStash_07.name: Drag a helmet into the helmet Slot

MS_Onboarding_Intro_OpenStash_08.name: Drag a Scanner into your backpack

MS_Onboarding_Intro_FirstMatch_01.name: Access the Launch Terminal and deploy to Fortuna III

MS_Onboarding_Intro_FirstMatch_02.name: Hold <inputAction light=true name=Social/>) to open your <B1>Communication Wheel</>. This enables you to communicate with nearby prospectors. Try selecting an option now.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_FirstMatch_03.name: Hold <inputAction light=true name=PushToTalk/> to enable <B1>Push To Talk</> if you are using a microphone.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_FirstMatch_LastWarni.name: Noise can attract other prospectors or hostile creatures. Your Melee Weapon (<inputAction light=true name=SwitchWeapon3/>) enables you to perform silent attacks. Hold the attack button to charge a heavy attack.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_FirstMatch_04.name: Complete you first Mission! Remember to check your Map (<inputAction light=true name=ToggleMap/>) and Mission Info (<inputAction light=true name=ShowContractsInHud/>) for details.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_FirstMatch_05.name: Find an Evac location and get off the planet - the ship can take some time to arrive!

MS_Onboarding_Intro_FirstMatch_06.name: Go to the faction HQ and complete your Mission

MS_Onboarding_Intro_MakingALiving_01.name: Go to any of the Faction leaders to get one or more Missions

MS_Onboarding_NpcText_BadumGenericDialog.name: What's up?  You should be all set now; check with the factions if you need work, and don't forget to upgrade your Quarters when you can, it'll make your life up here far easier.

MS_TutorialQuest_01_StepTitle.name: Find your <B1>Evac</> Location, call down a Ship and evacuate to complete the simulation.   Completing your <B1>Mission</> (Press <inputAction light=true name=ShowContractsInHud

MS_TutorialQuest_02_StepTitle.name: Get inside the ship before it leaves to evacuate!

MS_TutorialStep_Title_Loot.name: Search the area for anything useful

MS_TutorialStep_Desc_Welcome.name: Catch your bearings - <B1>Gather loot</>, <B1>hunt creatures</> and try to <B1>survive</> this training simulation!  Completing your <B1>Missions</> (Press <inputAction light=true name=ShowContractsInHud

MS_TutorialStep_Desc_Scan01.name: Equip your <B1>scanner</> (Hold <inputAction light=true name=ToolWheel/>) to search for <B1>minerals</>

MS_TutorialStep_Desc_Scan02.name: Use your <B1>scanner</> (Press <inputAction light=true name=Fire/>) to search for <B1>minerals</>

MS_TutorialStep_Desc_Mine01.name: Equip your <B1>pickaxe</> (Hold <inputAction light=true name=ToolWheel/>) to mine <B1>minerals</>

MS_TutorialStep_Desc_Mine02.name: Use your <B1>pickaxe</> (Press <inputAction light=true name=Fire/>) to mine for <B1>minerals</>

MS_TutorialStep_Desc_HealthStim01.name: Equip your <B1>Combat Stim</> (Hold <inputAction light=true name=ConsumableWheel/>) then use it (<inputAction light=true name=Fire/>) to heal yourself

MS_TutorialStep_Desc_Map01.name: Press <inputAction light=true name=ToggleMap/> to open your <B1>map</> and look for your <B1>evac</> location

MS_TutorialStep_Desc_Evac02.name: Call in your <B1>evac ship</> (Press <inputAction light=true name=CallEvac/>)

MS_TutorialStep_Desc_Evac03.name: Wait for your <B1>evac ship</> to arrive.   <B1>Warning!</> - Evac ship will crush anything beneath it when landing!

MS_TutorialStep_Desc_Evac04.name: Head into the <B1>evac ship</> before it departs

MS_TutorialStep_Desc_Evac05.name: You missed the <B1>evac ship</>! Call it again to head off the planet

MS_TutorialStep_Desc_Inventory01.name: Open your inventory(Press <inputAction light=true name=OpenMatchInventory/>). Then drag an item into your <B1>Safe Pockets</>.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_PlayerQuarters_01.name: Return to Badum at the bar

MS_Onboarding_Intro_PlayerQuarters_02.name: Go to your new Prospector Quarters

MS_Onboarding_Intro_PlayerQuarters_06.name: Construct the first Supply Crate Upgrade

MS_Onboarding_Intro_PlayerQuarters_07.name: Access the Delivery Station in your Quarters

MS_Onboarding_Intro_PlayerQuarters_09.name: Your Delivery Station
MS_Onboarding_Intro_PlayerQuarters_09.description: Your Delivery Station will also contain any Twitch Drops you're entitled to, Welcome Packs purchased in past seasons, and other unique deliveries meant for you.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_Crafting_01.name: Return to Badum at the bar

MS_Onboarding_Intro_Crafting_02.name: Go to the Public Gear Printer

MS_Onboarding_Intro_Crafting_05.name: Wait for printing to be complete, or skip the timer for the Medium Backpack at the Public Gear Printer.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_FactionShop_03.name: Here you can sell items from your stash to gain K-Marks and Faction Reputation.  Remember, no refunds! Don't sell anything you might need!

MS_Onboarding_Returning_ReturnToBadum_01.name: Talk to Badum at The Lucky Leafman Bar

MS_Onboarding_Intro_CompleteContractFail.name: Return to Badum to claim another set of equipment

MS_Onboarding_Intro_Insurance_Intro_01.name: Apply <B1>Standard Insurance</> to one or more of your items.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_Insurance_Claim_01.name: Access the Delivery Station in your Quarters to see information about pending Insurance Packages.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_Insurance_Claim_02.name: Here you can claim available Insurance Packages or see how long it takes for them to become available.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_Insurance_Survived_0.name: Standard Insurance for your items expires after each drop. Gear Salvage Insurance is permanent.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_CraftingStation_Craf.name: You can print various items with the Public Gear Printer. Each item has a material cost and requires time to be printed. The printing duration can be skipped for a cost.  Select the Repair Tab when you are ready.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_CraftingStation_Repa.name: Here you can repair items with reduced durability.

MS_Onboarding_Intro_FreeLoadouts_01.name: Free loadouts contain randomized gear and are available in certain time intervals.

Description_NVIDIA_DLSS.name: NVIDIA DLSS uses AI to boost frame rates while maintaining great image quality and responsiveness.   <BH2>- Requires a GeForce RTX graphics card.</>

Description_DLSS_FrameGeneration.name: Frame Generation boosts frame rates by using AI to render additional frames.   <BH2>- Requires a GeForce RTX 40 series graphics card.</> <BH2>- Windows users must enable 'Hardware-accelerated GPU Scheduling'.</> <BH2>- Requires DirectX 12.</>

Description_DLSS_SuperResolution.name: Super Resolution boosts frame rates by rendering fewer pixels and using AI to output high resolution frames.  <BH1>Off:</> Disabled <BH1>Auto:</> Selects the best DLSS mode for the current output resolution. <BH1>Quality:</> Offers higher image quality than Balanced mode. <BH1>Balanced:</> Offers both optimized performance and image quality. <BH1>Performance:</> Offers a higher performance boost than Balanced mode. <BH1>Ultra Performance:</> Offers the highest performance boost. Only recommended for 8k gameplay!  <BH2>- Requires a GeForce RTX graphics card.</>

Description_NVIDIA_Reflex.name: NVIDIA Reflex reduces system latency and increases PC responsiveness. <BH1>Off:</> Disabled <BH1>On:</> Aligns game engine work to complete just-in-time for rendering. <BH1>Boost:</> Additionally lowers latency at the cost of higher power consumption

Description_NVIDIA_Reflex_Disabled.name: NVIDIA Reflex reduces system latency and increases PC responsiveness. <BH1>NVIDIA Reflex must remain enabled while DLSS Frame Generation is active</>

Description_FSR.name: <BH1>Off:</> Disabled <BH1>Ultra Quality:</> 77% input resolution <BH1>Quality:</> 67% input resolution <BH1>Balanced:</> 59% input resolution <BH1>Performance:</> 50% input resolution <BH1>Ultra Quality (Hybrid):</> 77% input resolution, with additional Temporal upscaling <BH1>Quality (Hybrid):</> 67% input resolution, with additional Temporal upscaling <BH1>Balanced (Hybrid):</> 59% input resolution, with additional Temporal upscaling <BH1>Performance (Hybrid):</> 50% input resolution, with additional Temporal upscaling

Description_FullscreenMode.name: <BH1>Fullscreen:</> Dedicated fullscreen mode <BH1>Windowed Fullscreen:</> Best of both worlds <BH1>Windowed:</> Classic application window

Description_Resolution.name: Change the resolution size when display mode is set to fullscreen orwindowed, not for fullscreen windowed.

Description_MaxFPS.name: Allows for locking to a set FPS to minimalize fluctuation offering a more consistent experience.

Description_MaxFPSStation.name: Allows for locking to a set FPS to minimalize fluctuation offering a more consistent experience.  <BH1>Lowering this value can help to reduce system strain whilst idling between matches.</>

Description_FOV.name: Changing the field of view allows for showing more of the surrounding area but making the center area appear further away.

Description_Gamma.name: Controls the brightness of the game. Adjust until the top Leafman is barely visible.

Description_ColorblindType.name: Using the image below, switch between <BH1>Protanopia, Deuteranopia, and Tritanopia colorblind</> modes until you can see as clearly as possible the most numbers. This changes the color of all screen elements.

Description_ColorblindIntensity.name: Use the slider to adjust the intensity of the chosen colorblind mode.

Description_AutoDetect.name: Auto detect the best video settings or allows for further customization.

Description_VideoQuality.name: Select a quality preset. This option changes to custom when another option was manually changed.

Description_ResolutionQuality.name: Scales the internal rendering resolution, which is then upsampled to the specified Display Resolution. Very effective for trading image sharpness for GPU performance.

Description_AntiAliasingQuality.name: Smoothens edges and colors to make them appear less jagged and more appealing.

Description_DrawDistance.name: Adjusts at which distance specific assets will be made visible.

Description_ShadowQuality.name: Adjusts the visual quality of shadows and the detail.

Description_TextureQuality.name: Adjusts the texture quality of surfaces making them appear more or less sharp.

Description_FoliageQuality.name: Adjusts the quality of the foliage.

Description_VSync.name: Locks the frame rate based on the monitors refresh rate to eliminate screen tearing.

Description_ShowFPS.name: Shows an fps counter in the HUD.

Description_EnableMultiThreadedRendering.name: Allows for the game to use an additional thread which can improve the performance if the CPU allows.

Description_EnableDX12.name: Runs the game with DX12. On newer hardware this can result in improved rendering performance. Requires a game restart. NOTE: This feature is experimental.

Description_EnableGPUCrashDebug.name: To enable further debugging which can help track down crashes that are being experienced.

Description_EnableMotionBlur.name: Adds a sense of motion by blurring the surrounding environment when looking around. Does not apply when using Low Post Process Quality settings.

Description_ImageSharpening.name: Enhances the overall sharpness of the game.

Description_MasterVolume.name: Adjust the overall volume of the game.

Description_MusicVolume.name: Adjusts the music volume of the game.

Description_SoundEffectsVolume.name: Adjusts the sound effects volume of the game.

Description_DialogueVolume.name: Adjusts the volume of Comm Wheel chatter and NPC dialogue.

Description_HitmarkerVolume.name: Adjusts the hit marker volume when hitting a target.

Description_UnfocusedWindowVolume.name: The volume multiplier used when the game window is not in focus

Description_PushToTalk.name: Turn push to talk on or off. The allocated key can be adjusted in keybinds.

Description_InputDevice.name: Select the preferred audio input device.

Description_MicrophoneSensitivity.name: Adjust the input sensitivity for when the microphone should broadcast if push to talk is disabled.

Description_MuteInputAudio.name: Disables any input audio that would be broadcasted to other players.

Description_OutputDevice.name: Select the preferred audio output device.

Description_OutputVolume.name: Adjust the voice output volume from other players.

Description_MuteOutputAudio.name: Disables any incoming audio from other players.

Description_MouseSmoothing.name: Smooths down the movement for mice that do not have a high DPI.

Description_EnablePerScopeSensitivity.name: Enables further individual adjustments based on the variety of in-game optic magnifications.

Description_ADSSensitivity.name: The sensitivity that is used when aiming down the sights without an optic offering a magnification. Example: Iron sights.

Description_ScopeMultiplierSensitivity.name: Sensitivity override per individual optic magnification.

Description_ScopedSensitivity.name: The sensitivity that is used when aiming down sights.

Description_FOVBasedSensitivityScaling.name: Automatically scales mouse sensitivity relative to the current weapon / optic FOV. This ensures that the same amount of mouse movement is required to move the camera for the same amount on screen, independently of weapon / optic FOV.

Description_SprintToggle.name: Allows for sprint to be either on toggle or hold.

Description_CrouchToggle.name: Allows for crouchto be either on toggle or hold.

Description_TargetingToggle.name: Allows for targeting to be either on toggle or hold.

Description_LeaningToggle.name: Allows for leaning to be either on toggle or hold.

Description_Language.name: Change the in game text to another language.

Description_RotateMinimap.name: Rotation of the mini map based on the direction the player is facing.

Description_FieldOfViewMovementChanges.name: Allow for field of view changes based on the movement states. This might sell the effect that you sprint faster.

Description_ChatEnabled.name: Always show the chat widget on screen when someone chats.

Description_ChatEnabledEnglish.name: Enables access to the English channel in text chat.

Description_ChatEnabledGerman.name: Enables access to the German channel in text chat.

Description_ChatEnabledRussian.name: Enables access to the Russian channel in text chat.

Description_ChatEnabledFrench.name: Enables access to the French channel in text chat.

Description_ChatEnabledSpanish.name: Enables access to the Spanish channel in text chat.

Description_ChatEnabledBrazilian.name: Enables access to the Brazilian and Portuguese channel in text chat.

Description_ChatEnabledPolish.name: Enables access to the Polish channel in text chat.

Description_ChatEnabledTurkish.name: Enables access to the Turkish channel in text chat.

Description_ChatEnabledChinese.name: Enables access to the Chinese channel in text chat.

Description_UIScale.name: Adjusts the size of all interface elements either larger or smaller.

Description_NotificationFilterWorkbench.name: Show Gear Printer notifications in the HUD. You can check these in the Notification Log.

Description_NotificationFilterPlayerQuar.name: Show Player Quarter notifications in the HUD. You can check these in the Notification Log.

Description_NotificationFilterFriendStat.name: Show Friend Status notifications in the HUD.

Description_NotificationFilterSquadUpdat.name: Show Squad Status notifications in the HUD.

Description_NotificationFilterFriendInvi.name: Show Friend Invite notifications in the HUD.

Description_NotificationFilterSquadInvit.name: Show Squad Invite notifications in the HUD.

Description_NotificationFilterFortunaPas.name: Show Fortuna Pass notifications in the HUD. You can check these in the Notification Log.

Description_RenderingDeviceAdapter.name: Forces selection of the rendering adapter to be used once the game restarts. Don't change this unless you are having issues.

Description_BinauralAudio.name: Enables binaural audio for audio spatialization.

Description_EnableHighlights.name: Enable or disable the automatic capture of key moments during gameplay, via Nvidia Shadowplay Highlights.

Shop_Offer_StarterPack2022_1.name: Initiate Pack
Shop_Offer_StarterPack2022_1.description: New to Fortuna III? This Welcome Pack will give you a head start; with a unique outfit and weapon skin, some gear to get you started, plus a fistful of Aurum, you'll fit right in! Includes 250 Aurum.

Shop_Offer_StarterPack2022_2.name: Professional Pack
Shop_Offer_StarterPack2022_2.description: An unprepared Prospector won't last long on Fortuna III, so give yourself some love with this Welcome Pack, netting you two unique outfits, unique weapon skins, a fair amount of Aurum, and a good bit of extra kit! What's not to like? Includes 625 Aurum.

Shop_Offer_StarterPack2022_3.name: Specialist Pack
Shop_Offer_StarterPack2022_3.description: Want to show off your skills? With this Welcome Pack you'll be ready for anything Fortuna III throws at you! You'll get three unique outfits, unique weapon skins, and enough Aurum and gear to keep you fighting! Includes 1000 Aurum.

Shop_Offer_StarterPack2022_4.name: Elite Pack
Shop_Offer_StarterPack2022_4.description: The best Prospectors always come prepared, and with this ultimate Welcome Pack you'll be sure to thrive! You get four unique outfits, a premium Jumpsuit variant, unique weapon skins, plus a mountain of Aurum and gear! Includes 3000 Aurum.

Shop_Offer_PrimeTimePack2022.name: Prime Time!
Shop_Offer_PrimeTimePack2022.description: Get ready for the limelight! The Prime Time pack is here with one of Fortuna III's most striking prospectors, along with an assortment of dazzling masks fit for any occasion!

Shop_SyndicateEnforcer10_Gloves.name: Elite Enforcer - Gloves
Shop_SyndicateEnforcer10_Gloves.description: Oh, you know you pissed off the wrong people if the guy coming for you's wearing these...

Shop_BountyHunter02_Archetype.description: Bounty hunting may be a rough job, doesn't mean you can't look great doing it!

Shop_BountyHunter02_Boots.description: Don't let your mark outrun you!

Shop_Marshal02_Boots.description: No one's getting away while you're wearing these!

Shop_FounderPacks.description: Thank you for playing The Cycle!   If you would like to support the development of the game you can purchase one of our Founder's Packs!  Each Founders Pack immediately unlocks exclusive costumes and weapon skins, and contains in-game currency at a one-time discount. In-game currency can be used later this year in our in-game shop.  This incredible offer is only available for a limited time and will be removed when The Cycle officially launches.   The purchase of a Founder's Pack happens via the Epic Games Store - clicking on the purchase button will redirect you to our store page.

Station_OnboardingOverlay_Launch_SocialL.name: Connect with us and stay up to date!

Station_OnboardingOverlay_Launch_Trainin.name: Test your loadout and all our guns

Station_OnboardingOverlay_Launch_SoloTra.name: Virtual training match with no other players

Station_OnboardingOverlay_Launch_PopupBo.name: Welcome to Prospect Station!  This is the PLAY screen. From here you can select which game mode to queue for and play.  Training Matches allow for playing a match with no other players; while they do not grant rewards, they are good for training. The Shooting Range allows for quickly testing your loadout, as well as try out any weapon or ability.  The Tutorial, Training Match, and Shooting can be launched while matchmaking; you will be pulled into the match when a game is found.

Station_OnboardingOverlay_InventoryMods_.name: This is the MODS screen  Mods can be applied to weapons and suits to alter their behavior. Each mod is unique to that item, even if a similar mod exists for another item.  Here you'll be able to purchase and equip item mods, as well as see the effects they will have.

Station_OnboardingOverlay_InventoryDetai.name: Item name, type, and in-match price
Visual preview and mod slot overview
Purchase, equip, or scrap an item

This is the ITEM DETAILS screen.  Here you can see information on the selected item, as well as customize it with mods or vanity.  Items can be obtained from the different faction markets if you have enough standing and can pay the Krypto Marks licensing cost.  Items must be equipped to your loadout in order to be purchasable in-match through the Gear Store.

Station_OnboardingOverlay_Inventory_Popu.name: This is the PRINTING screen.  Your items are printed using blueprints, which are granted to you by the various factions and require specific materials, collected during matches or from match rewards.  Here you can print items from your blueprints, check the requirements needed for printing, and head to item details to modify your printed items.

Station_OnboardingOverlay_GearSet_Starti.name: Suit and secondary weapon you start the match with

Station_OnboardingOverlay_GearSet_GearSt.name: Selection of items you can buy in-match

Station_OnboardingOverlay_GearSet_PopupB.name: This is your LOADOUT  Each match you start with only your suit, a secondary weapon, and your wits. Your suit affects your health and movement abilities, such as access to a jetpack or rapid dodging.  The Gear Store Supplies section lists the selection of items items you'll have available for purchase during a match using in-match currency.

Station_OnboardingOverlay_Factions_Popup.name: This is the FACTIONS screen.  Factions control Prospect Station and hire prospectors to complete Jobs on the surface.  You can choose to work for any of the three factions at the start of a match, with your standing increasing based on your final match position. Improve your standing with to unlock access to blueprints for weapons, suits, abilities, and more.  Here you can see your progress with each faction and what their next standing levels will grant you.

Station_OnboardingOverlay_Appearance_Pop.name: This is the APPEARANCE screen.  Here you can alter your appearance by choosing between various base prospector types and costume options for each.  You can also select a banner, choose which emote to use, and which foam pose your rivals will perform when you defeat them.  Appearance items can be unlocked through Shop purchases or granted by levelling up through the Fortuna Pass.  Note that appearance changes have no effect on gameplay.

Station_OnboardingOverlay_Shop_PopupBody.name: This is the SHOP  Here you can purchase new appearance items like weapon vanity, emotes, or costumes to customize your appearance, as well as Gold Access for the Fortuna Pass to begin unlocking even more exclusive content by completing various challenges.  The currency used in the shop is Aurum; Aurum can be acquired with real-money purchases in the shop, with Founder's Packs, or by progressing through the Fortuna Pass.

Station_OnboardingOverlay_Seasons_PopupB.name: This is the FORTUNA PASS screen.  The Fortuna Pass allows you to get exclusive rewards by completing challenges and earning XP to level up throughout the season.  Gold Access access will reward you with even more items as you progress through the season.  Here you can track active challenges and your season progress.

Station_HolidayEvent01_Popup_Body.name: Cool new coatings and a discount on season levels!

Station_Ranked_RewardsExplainer.name: Special rewards are handed out for ranked play at the end of each ranked season.

Station_Ranked_HOFSubHeadline.name: Top ranking prospectors of past seasons are forever immortalized in the Hall of Fame.

Station_Ranked_NoRankDataAvailable.name: No current ranked data available for this game mode.

Station_Ranked_LobbyScreen_RankedModeExp.name: - No random gear finds - For higher ranking, make sure to evacuate with as many points as possible

Station_Season2_Started_Popup_1.name: Season 2 has arrived - Fortuna III just got a whole lot bigger!

Station_Season2_Started_Popup_2.name: Explore the abandoned colony of Crescent Falls - delve deeper into the story of the Lost Prospector on the new map. Unlock two brand new archetypes - the Troublemaker and the Korolev Paladin, and get almost 200 rewards with the new season pass, including fresh weapon and outfit skins, drop pod and grav bike customization, and much, much more!
