Station_MajorNPC_Korolev_NPC01_Title.name: Head of Operations for Korolev on Fortuna III

Station_Button_ToVIP_Denied.name: Finish Badum's final mission to enter

Station_ScreenText_Badum.description: Acts as the intermediary between the station, factions, and prospectors, but more importantly runs the local bar

Station_ScreenText_Badum_Intro.name: Hey Prospector, nice to have you here. These days everyone is trying to scavenge whatever they can get from the planet. But I have a soft sport for young bloods like you. So here's some gear for you to start with, use it wisely! Whatever you lose on Fortuna III is gone for good, the storm will make sure of that. Now, go check out the rest of the station!

Station_Insurance_Purchase_Tooltip.name: Standard Insurance will return a percentage of an item's value in case you fail to evac for this drop. You will need to reinsure the item for each drop.  Gear Salvage Insurance flags an item for recovery; if the item isn't looted by another prospector, it will be returned to you after some time. If someone did loot and evac with it, then you will receive a K-Mark compensation instead. Gear Salvage will compensate item attachments, but only if they remained on the insured item before being retrieved.  Gear Salvage Insurance status remains on the item across multiple drops, until the item is lost or its insurance is triggered.   Insured items that are dropped prior to death or looted by squadmates are not compensated.   Quitting a match early will result in insurance being voided and no compensation given.

Station_Insurance_Purchase_MaxClaimsDesc.name: You have too many unclaimed insurance packages. Claim insurance packages in your Quarters.

Station_Insurance_ClaimsVary_Tooltip.name: Insured items that are dropped prior to death or stolen by squadmates are not compensated. If an item is marked to be salvaged but is stolen by another player, you will receive a compensation in K-Marks.

Station_Insurance_Desc_Short.name: Final compensation may vary. Claim any payouts in your quarters.

Station_Insurance_Setup_DescPremium.name: In case of a failed evac, items marked for salvage will be returned to your quarters, or a compensation in K-Marks delivered in the event they were looted by a rival. Gear Salvage is paid once and the insured status remains until the items is lost.

Station_Insurance_Setup_DescStandard.name: Pay a fraction of an item's cost to receive a fair sum back in the case of an untimely death. Standard Insurance for an item is paid per drop. Payouts will be delivered to your Quarters.

Station_Insurance_Setup_TipPremium.name: Place items here to flag them for a Salvage attempt if you fail to evac.

Station_Insurance_Setup_TipStandard.name: Place items here to insure them for a K-Mark payout if you fail to evac

Station_Insurance_Setup_CostDesc.name: Salvage attempt costs increase by the total of slots. Salvage tokens pay a slot for free.

Station_Insurance_Tooltip_Loadout.name: You insured this item. Keep it with you so your insurance pays out in case of death.

Station_Insurance_Tooltip_LoadoutStation.name: You already insured this item. Keep it with you when taking it to Fortuna III so your insurance pays out in case of death.

Station_Insurance_Tooltip_OutOfLoadout.name: Warning: You insured this item. Pick it up again so your insurance pays out in case of death.

Station_Insurance_Tooltip_Squadmate.name: Warning: Your squadmate insured this item. If you pick it up, you will void your squadmate's insurance!

Station_Insurance_Tooltip_Pending.name: You have selected this item to be insured upon deploying to Fortuna III.

Station_Insurance_Invalidate_Equip_Messa.name: When you equip or unequip an attachment from an insured item, it voids the insurance. Equip attachment and void your insurance for this item?

Station_Insurance_Invalidate_Unequip_Mes.name: When you unequip or equip an attachment from an insured item, it voids the insurance. Unequip attachment and void your insurance for this item?

Station_Insurance_Setup_Limit_Exceeded.name: Too many Insurance Packages pending; please redeem pending packages, or remove insured gear from loadout.

Station_Insurance_Generator_Status_NoCla.name: Insure your items before deploying and come back in the case of an untimely foaming.

Station_Insurance_PackageDetails_Desc.name: Once an insurance package is ready, you'll be able to claim the payout. If you have additional insurance packages ready to be claimed they'll be available once you've claimed the oldest.

Station_Insurance_PackageStatus_Reason.name: Notice: Not all items marked for salvage could be retrieved. Additional K-Marks were added to compensate the loss. If your squadmate took your gear, there is no compensation.

Station_Insurance_VoidDeathWarning.name: WARNING: Insurance will NOT be paid out if you fall into the void in Tharis Island's caverns

Station_Insurance_VoidDeathEoM.name: Your insurance was voided due to falling into the void.

Station_Insurance_VoidQuit.name: Your insurance was voided due to prospector self-termination.

Station_TechTree_2.description: Life on Fortuna III is tough, but that doesn't need to carry to Prospect Station!  Crafting Quarters upgrades will allow you to improve your inventory sizes, printing speeds, and even generate daily income and supplies. Upgrade each path to unlock new Quarter levels and access even more improvements!

Station_TechTree_Inventory.description: Increase the capacity of your Stash in the Station, and your Safe Pockets in your loadout.

Station_TechTree_Generators.description: Unlock and improve daily generation of K-Marks, Aurum, and Supply Crates.

Station_MapLocked.name: This location is currently not available

Station_Map01Description.name: This small cape's beautiful beaches washed away long ago. Abandoned facilities meant to support what was to be a grand science campus offer good salvage. Exercise caution near the jungle.

Station_Map02Description.name: Now nearly completely overtaken by vegetation, this area was once popular for the 'restorative' hot springs surrounding the ancient Progenitor monument at its center. Even experienced prospectors should be cautious here.

Station_Map03Description.name: Despite being a remote islet first believed to be of little interest, rumors of mysteries and fantastic wealth abound for the caverns at its center. Be warned, few that venture underground return unscathed.

Station_SafePocket_Tooltip.name: Items placed in your Safe Pockets will not be lost if you do not successfuly evac. Use this space for valuable or important loot you don't want to lose.

Station_RetentionBonus_Announcement.name: Login {amount} days during the closed beta free rewards!

Station_RetentionBonus.description: Receive a new item based on the days you login (up to {amount} days) Items are automatically added to your Inventory.

Station_RetentionBonus_SeasonEndBodyWith.name: Don't miss out on any Fortuna Pass rewards! Once the season ends in {remaining}, you'll keep your Aurum and Vanity items, but your K-Mark balance, Stash, Faction progress, and Quarters upgrades will reset for the next season.

Station_RedeemCode_Subline.name: Enter your code to redeem it.

Station_RedeemCode_Delivery.name: Claim your rewards in the Special Deliveries section in the Player Quarters.

Station_RedeemCode_Claimed.name: You can find your rewards inside your stash.

Station_RetentionBonus_SeasonStartInfo.name: Thank you for joining us for Season 2 of The Cycle: Frontier! While every prospector starts the new season fresh, your Aurum and cosmetic items have been carried over and can be used immediately. And if you purchased a bundle in the past, check your Delivery Station to retrieve your items. Now, enjoy Fortuna III, and be sure to check out the new Fortuna Pass!

Station_FreeLoadout_Subline.name: Choose between your current Loadout or Free Faction Loadout

Station_FreeLoadout_SublineTooltip.name: Factions regularly give free gear to promote prospecting. You keep the gear if you evac with it. You'll need to wait some time after using a Free Loadout until it's  available again.

Station_FreeLoadout_InfoText.name: {FactionName} provides prospectors with free randomized loadouts to ensure contracts can be completed. If you already used your free loadout, wait some time until it's available again.

Station_FreeLoadout_StashFull_ErrorDescr.name: Using a Free Loadout moves the items in your current Loadout to your Stash. Please <BH2>free up {NumItems} more slots in your stash</> to use this free loadout

Station_FreeLoadout_LoadoutICADescriptio.name: The ICA has pitched in to get you a new Loadout. Use it well, the station depends on you!

Station_FreeLoadout_LoadoutOsirisDescrip.name: Osiris has some refurbished kit for you, works just like new! Or say they say, at least.

Station_FreeLoadout_LoadoutKorolevDescri.name: Korolev always tries to produce over the quota, for when their machinery inevitably breaks down*. Good workers like you get to use the spares.  *From producing over quota.

Station_FreeLoadout_LoadoutCotecDescript.name: An assortment of spare and salvaged gear available to prospectors.

Station_FreeLoadout_LoadouGenericDescrip.name: An assortment of spare and salvaged gear available to prospectors.

Station_FreeLoadout_InventoryEquippedInf.name: If you don't want to use it now, revert the activation to equip your default loadout.

Station_LoadoutPresets_InfoBoxBody.name: Save a full Loadout as a Preset. Presets allow you to quickly equip a full loadout. Go to your Stash and press 'Save as Preset' to save your current Loadout, then click on Activate on any Preset screen to equip it.  Items will first be pulled from your Stash if you own them, then purchased from the Markets if you have access to them. Some items may be unavailable to equip. Any items in your current Loadout will be moved to your Stash on applying a Preset. Presets cannot be equipped if your Stash is in an overflow state.  Note that Attachments will not be removed from existing configurations when applying a preset. Altered gear perk configurations are not saved to presets.

Station_LoadoutPresets_SavePresetPromptB.name: Presets can be used to quickly equip a full loadout. Chose which preset slot you would like use to save this loadout. This will overwrite any loadout already in that preset.

Station_LoadoutPresets_ActivatePresetPro.name: Any items in your current Loadout that don't fit this Preset will be moved to your Stash. New items will be taken from your Stash first if available, and items you don't own will be purchased from the markets if you have access to them.
Some items in this preset cannot be purchased and will not be applied to your Loadout.

Station_LoadoutPresets_ActivatePresetAct.name: You can now deploy with this Loadout

Station_LoadoutPresets_ItemStatus_Owned.name: You own this item; it's stored in your Stash or Loadout

Station_LoadoutPresets_ItemStatus_Purcha.name: This item is available in the Markets

Station_LoadoutPresets_ItemStatus_Attach.name: You own this item. Attachment(s) are available in the Markets

Station_LoadoutPresets_ItemStatus_Unavai.name: This item is unavailable and must be Printed

Station_LoadoutPresets_ItemStatus_Attach.name: You own this item. Attachment(s) are unavailable and must be Printed

Station_LoadoutPresets_ItemStatus_Unavai.name: This item is unavailable and must be Forged

Station_LoadoutPresets_ItemStatus_Attach.name: You own this item. Attachment(s) are unavailable

Station_LoadoutPresets_StashOverflowErro.name: Please free up slots in your stash to equip a Preset

Duel_Invite_Failed_Max_Count.name: Duel failed, max duels with this prospector reached!

Tips_Misc_01.name: The Cycle is a deadly energy field surrounding Fortuna III with a cyclical decline and surge. Your time window on the surface is short, make it count.

Tips_Misc_02.name: Fortuna III's ecosystem is heavily affected by the energy field known as The Cycle. The storms caused by surges in The Cycle will aggravate the planet's fauna, so be careful and make sure to gear up.

Tips_Misc_03.name: Establishing a comm link allows you to communicate over radio with other Prospectors.

Tips_Misc_04.name: Remember to gear up before you drop down to the surface. You'll want to be able to defend yourself on Fortuna III.

Tips_MetaProgression_01.name: Work for factions and gain their recognition. They will give you access to their tech in return.

Tips_ContractLicenses_01.name: Contract licenses are a great way to earn Krypto Marks.

Tips_Quest_PowerUp_01.name: When powering up a station be wary of other Prospectors trying to claim the main generator for themselves.

Tips_Quest_PowerUp_02.name: Be careful, some facilities will deploy old guard droids while being powered up, and they probably won't be friendly.

Tips_Quest_Minerals_01.name: Mining minerals creates noise and attracts aggressive creatures. Larger mineral deposits will draw in more creatures, and Prospectors.

Tips_Quest_Minerals_02.name: Mineral drills project a locator beacon when their work is complete to help you relocate them. Unfortunately your rivals can see it too.

Tips_Quest_Uplink_01.name: Once you are synced with an Uplink it will reveal locations of both objectives and other players on your map.

Tips_Quest_Trophy_01.name: The zeal shard's radiation signature is visible to all Prospectors, be careful.

Tips_Quest_LaserDrill_01.name: The Korolev laser drill can be used as an alternative way to get back to Prospect Station.

Tips_Quest_LaserDrill_02.name: Korolev laser drills generate large amounts of precious metals as it drills for letium.

Tips_Quest_Boss_01.name: The Warden Alpha is a tough beast, and it always brings angry friends along.

Tips_Quest_Boss_02.name: The Warden Alpha can be summoned by placing a bait at its feeding grounds.

Tips_Quest_Mushrooms_01.name: Brightcap Mushrooms are valuable, so collect them if you see them. Be careful, you're not the only one that wants them.

BFCGameIntro_01.name: Decades ago we settled on Fortuna III, and for a while this frontier world was paradise.

BFCGameIntro_02.name: We mined its vast resources in the shadow of ancient ruins.

BFCGameIntro_03.name: Then one day the planet turned on us, with freak storms forcing us to evacuate the colony.

BFCGameIntro_04.name: With the Surface lost, we set up base on Prospect Station, orbiting the deadly planet.

BFCGameIntro_05.name: It's where we trade, arm ourselves, gear up for the next drop. It's home.

BFCGameIntro_06.name: My names Badum, I run things up here. So, you wanna be a Prospector?

BFCGameIntro_07.name: I've seen all types try their luck on the surface...

BFCGameIntro_08.name: Some are relentless, stopping at nothing and risking it all.

BFCGameIntro_09.name: Others are more the furtive sort, using stealth and caution to beat the odds.

BFCGameIntro_10.name: Many drop as a crew, sharing the loot, never leaving anyone behind.

BFCGameIntro_11.name: And of course therere the hunters, preying on other prospectors and taking their haul.

BFCGameIntro_12.name: Skill might keep you alive, but youll need more than that to thrive on Fortuna III.

BFCGameIntro_13.name: In the end, anything goes in the hunt for fame and fortune.

BFCGameIntro_14.name: Welcome to The Frontier, I think youll fit in here just fine.

BFCStationFTUEAlt01.name: So you made it to the surface on your own; eager one, aren't you?  Seeing as you skipped orientation day, you might need some pointers. You're now officially a Prospector; someone brave, desperate, or crazy enough to scavenge through Fortuna III's overrun colony sites for resources, retrieve exotic samples, or just shoot up some aliens. Whatever the factions pay you to do, really. Oh, and then evac off the surface, that's an important step.

BFCStationFTUEAlt02.name: Here's the rub: rule of law doesn't apply down there, and it's not just the local creatures that'll be after you.  Competition among prospectors is fierce, and most don't make it back to the station on their own two feet. If you get taken out, your suit will keep you and whatever's in your Safe Pockets in one piece, ready for rescue. But your gear and bag? That'll belong to someone else.  Come and see me once you're done down there, we should talk.

BFCStationFTUETalkToBadum01.name: Is that a new face on Prospect Station? Come over to my bar and I'll show you the ropes.

BFCStationFTUETalkToBadum02.name: So, you want to be a prospector?  Well first thing's first, head to any of the faction HQs and pick up a Job; that'll get you your name on the work roster and your first task on the surface. Don't worry about which faction to start with, you can take jobs from any of them at any time later on.  Come back when you've got a Contract and I'll get you started with some spare gear.

BFCStationFTUETalkToBadum03.name: Now, Fortuna III's real beautiful, but it's also real damn deadly. You'll need some gear before dropping down if you plan to survive. I'll get you started with some spares, but be careful; whatever you lose down there, you're not getting back!

BFCStationFTUETalkToBadum03B.name: Now, Fortuna III's real beautiful, but it's also real damn deadly. You'll need some gear before dropping down if you plan to survive. I'll get you started with some spares, but be careful; whatever you lose down there, you're not getting back!

BFCStationFTUEFirstMatch02.name: So, you made it to the surface!   Ah, back in the day the planet was a paradise, with the factions all vying for its natural wealth and resources... Now it's down to prospectors like you to grab what's left behind.  Old settlements and abandoned factories will be the best places to find anything valuable. Remember to put the real good stuff in your Safe Pockets, it'll stick with you even if you're taken out.

BFCStationFTUEFirstMatch03.name: Good work! Now it's time to head for an evac and call down a ship; check your map.

BFCStationFTUEFirstMatch04.name: If you don't get off the planet, your gear and backpack won't either, so make smart use of your Safe Pockets...

Now.name: go check with whichever faction sent you out and claim your contract's rewards.

And remember to put the good loot in you.name: it'll help offset any bad runs.

Remember to use your Safe Pockets to sto.name: and Insuring your Loadout will dampen the blow on your wallet when things go south.

Ah.name: the simple pleasures are the best.

WP_Shared_Scrappy.description: It has outlived it's glory days.

Weapons_WP_A_AR_Bullet_01.name: KOR-47
Weapons_WP_A_AR_Bullet_01.description: Heavy assault rifle. Lower rate of fire than others in its class, but packs a punch. Audible range: 400m
Weapons_WP_A_AR_Bullet_01.lore: The KOR Bullpup Automatic Rifle 2247, more commonly known as the KOR-47, is Korolev Heavy Industries' signature weapon and a mainstay of many national and private armed forces.

Weapons_WP_G_Pistol_Energy_01.name: Scarab
Weapons_WP_G_Pistol_Energy_01.description: A dependable pistol, fires in controlled and powerful three-shot bursts. Audible range: 300m
Weapons_WP_G_Pistol_Energy_01.lore: The Scarab, an Adaptive Phase Pistol, is one of Osiris' most successful weapons, able to induce a localized rapid matter state change on remote targets at a fraction of the energy cost of more conventional laser-based weaponry. With energy efficiency and safety in mind, the Scarab is a solid choice of sidearm, though its compact form limits the extent of its lethality.

Weapons_WP_G_Pistol_Energy_02.name: Scarab - Mk.II
Weapons_WP_G_Pistol_Energy_02.description: An improved version of the standard Scarab Adaptive Phase Pistol, custom built for the Osiris Harbinger Expeditionary Corps. A rare find, worth keeping hold of. Audible range: 300m
Weapons_WP_G_Pistol_Energy_02.lore: The Scarab, an Adaptive Phase Pistol, is one of Osiris' most successful weapons, able to induce a localized rapid matter state change on remote targets at a fraction of the energy cost of more conventional laser-based weaponry. With energy efficiency and safety in mind, the Scarab is a solid choice of sidearm, though its compact form limits the extent of its lethality.

Weapons_WP_G_SMG_Needle_01.name: Asp Flechette Gun
Weapons_WP_G_SMG_Needle_01.description: Lightweight SMG. A formidable automatic weapon for close range encounters. Audible range: 350m
Weapons_WP_G_SMG_Needle_01.lore: Intended for use by law enforcement in pressurized environments, this weapons' flechettes provide lethal stopping power, can easily defeat light armor, and are designed to prevent overpenetration; a risk in any environment, but disastrous on ships and stations.

Weapons_WP_G_SMG_Needle_02.name: Asp Flechette Gun - Prototype
Weapons_WP_G_SMG_Needle_02.description: A version of the Asp intitially intended for civilian security forces. Not as powerful as the eventual market version, but it's still a competent SMG.  Audible range: 350m
Weapons_WP_G_SMG_Needle_02.lore: Intended for use by law enforcement in pressurized environments, this weapons' flechettes provide lethal stopping power, can easily defeat light armor, and are designed to prevent overpenetration; a risk in any environment, but disastrous on ships and stations.

Weapons_WP_D_Sniper_Gauss_01.name: Kinetic Arbiter
Weapons_WP_D_Sniper_Gauss_01.description: A gauss sniper rifle that fires metal rods at immense velocity. Favored among Prospectors that want to resolve issues quickly quickly and from a safe distance. Audible range: 500m
Weapons_WP_D_Sniper_Gauss_01.lore: One of The ICA's most advanced conventional weapons, the Kinetic Arbiter is little more than a military-grade gauss gun stripped down to its most basic components needed to function, without any of the the fancy fittings or safety mechanisms.

Weapons_WP_A_HVY_Shell_01.name: KARLA
Weapons_WP_A_HVY_Shell_01.description: While able to neutralize heavily armored targets, the KARLA howitzer is unwieldy and suffers from a low rate of fire.
Weapons_WP_A_HVY_Shell_01.lore: The Korolev Anti-material Repeating Light Artillery, or KARLA, was originally intended as a vehicle-mounted weapon, but advanced recoil management allowed Korolev to produce a portable version for use without a warsuit.

Weapons_WP_D_SGun_Shard_01.name: Shattergun
Weapons_WP_D_SGun_Shard_01.description: An unconventional shotgun that fires shard fragments by shattering an unstable fuel crystal. Audible range: 350m
Weapons_WP_D_SGun_Shard_01.lore: Crafted on Prospect station using salvage and wood from the planet itself, this scattergun demonstrates The ICA's ingenuity and ability to thrive with limited resources. A molded adrentite crystal, byproduct of its refinement for use as rocket fuel, serves as both projectile and propellant; a small electric charge incites a rearrangement in the crystal's lattice, with the sudden energy release fracturing the crystal into thin shards along its length as they're shot through the barrel.

Weapons_WP_G_AR_Energy_01.name: Phasic Lancer
Weapons_WP_G_AR_Energy_01.description: A burst rifle that fires in accurate 3-shot bursts, effective against most threats a Prospector might encounter. Audible range: 400m
Weapons_WP_G_AR_Energy_01.lore: After the success of the Adaptive Phase Pistol, Osiris thought to develop a weapon platform of more interest to the military market. While this new powered-up weapon can handle significantly more energy than its smaller cousin, Osiris has yet to solve the problem of overheating in full-auto firing mode, or the high risk of carrier-shield leakage when in charged mode.

Weapons_WP_A_Pistol_Bullet_01.name: Hammer
Weapons_WP_A_Pistol_Bullet_01.description: A heavy pistol that can inflict devastating damage, at the cost of any kind of subtlety. Audible range: 400m
Weapons_WP_A_Pistol_Bullet_01.lore: Based on their ubiquitous rivet guns, also known as 'energy hammers', the 'Hammer' was an attempt at developing a low cost personal defense weapon. Popular among those wanting a dependable high-powered pistol, its weight and complex operation make it unattractive to the mass market.

Weapons_WP_A_Pistol_Bullet_02.name: Hammer - Prototype
Weapons_WP_A_Pistol_Bullet_02.description: An older version of the Hammer, still built by several difficult (read: expensive) to upgrade machines. Packs less of a punch, but still a beast. Audible range: 400m
Weapons_WP_A_Pistol_Bullet_02.lore: Based on their ubiquitous rivet guns, also known as 'energy hammers', the 'Hammer' was an attempt at developing a low cost personal defense weapon. Popular among those wanting a dependable high-powered pistol, its weight and complex operation make it unattractive to the mass market.

Weapons_WP_D_Pistol_Bullet_01.name: Bulldog
Weapons_WP_D_Pistol_Bullet_01.description: A powerful shotgun pistol that suffers from very limited range. Audible range: 300m
Weapons_WP_D_Pistol_Bullet_01.lore: Simple and effective, compact firearms utilizing shotgun shells are popular on stations as close range problem solvers for their high damage as well as for mitigating the risk of overpenetration that more conventional pistols carry. The Bulldog is the ICA's prefered design, easy to build and maintain, and even easier to operate.

Weapons_WP_D_AR_Bullet_01.name: Advocate
Weapons_WP_D_AR_Bullet_01.description: A dependable assault rifle that offers a good balance between accuracy and rate of fire. Audible range: 400m
Weapons_WP_D_AR_Bullet_01.lore: Based on the SAR-62 carbine used by the Federation itself, the ICA 'Advocate' has only a few deviations from the original design, meant to allow for its manufacture in environments of relative scarcity.

Weapons_WP_G_HVY_Beam_01.name: Zeus Beam
Weapons_WP_G_HVY_Beam_01.description: Called 'Zeus' for turning any mortal into the God of Lightning, it can fulminate any creature that meets your divine ire. Audible range: 350m
Weapons_WP_G_HVY_Beam_01.lore: While beam based weapons have found heavy use on warships for centuries, only in recent years has technology allowed for a portable form factor. These weapons use a linked-light beam to contain and focus a jet of plasma accross great distances, with a fairly predictable effect on whatever it contacts.

Weapons_WP_G_HVY_Beam_02.name: Zeus Beam - Prototype
Weapons_WP_G_HVY_Beam_02.description: An older prototype version of the mighty Zeus. Still capable of fulminating most targets. Audible range: 350m
Weapons_WP_G_HVY_Beam_02.lore: While beam based weapons have found heavy use on warships for centuries, only in recent years has technology allowed for a portable form factor. These weapons use a linked-light beam to contain and focus a jet of plasma accross great distances, with a fairly predictable effect on whatever it contacts.

Weapons_WP_A_Launch_MSL_01.name: KOMRAD
Weapons_WP_A_Launch_MSL_01.description: This fearsome weapon is fires salvos of fast-moving missiles capable of making short work of near any hostile element. Audible range: 500m
Weapons_WP_A_Launch_MSL_01.lore: Short for Korolev Ozone-powered Micro Rocket Assault Device, the KOMRAD is one of the most destructive weapon systems developed by the megacorp, and one of its most expensive.

WP_E_Pistol_Bullet_01_Scrappy.name: Rusty K-28
WP_E_Pistol_Bullet_01_Scrappy.description: An old rusty semi-automatic pistol. Its glory days are over. Audible range: 300m

WP_E_Sniper_Bullet_01.name: C-32 Bolt Action
WP_E_Sniper_Bullet_01.description: Bolt action sniper rifle that was commonly used by colonists. Accurate and dependable. Audible range: 500m
WP_E_Sniper_Bullet_01.lore: Anachronistic by design, this CoTEC bolt action rifle was meant for civilian use in frontier planets to manage hostile wildlife. Effective in its purpose, the massive increase in wildlife hostility and numbers lead to mass production of lower grade rifles like this one.

WP_E_Sniper_Bullet_02.name: C-32 Bolt Action - Mk.II
WP_E_Sniper_Bullet_02.description: A more powerful variant of the C-32 used by Sentinels to keep the peace outside the old settled areas. Audible range: 500m
WP_E_Sniper_Bullet_02.lore: Anachronistic by design, this CoTEC bolt action rifle was meant for civilian use in frontier planets to manage hostile wildlife. Effective in its purpose, the massive increase in wildlife hostility and numbers lead to mass production of lower grade rifles like this one.

Weapons_WP_E_SMG_Bullet_01.name: S-576 PDW
Weapons_WP_E_SMG_Bullet_01.description: A popular SMG with high rate of fire, formidable at close range. Audible range: 350m
Weapons_WP_E_SMG_Bullet_01.lore: The CoTEC S-576 is one of the standard firearms used aboard Federation ships, stations, and outposts. Lightweight, compact, and produced in mass by various manufacturers, this model is a staple in practically every weapons market. This model doesn't look quite right, but it still gets the job done.

Weapons_WP_E_SMG_Bullet_02.name: S-576 PDW - Mk.II
Weapons_WP_E_SMG_Bullet_02.description: An improved version of the S-576, meant for use by colony security forces before the surface was abandoned.  Audible range: 350m
Weapons_WP_E_SMG_Bullet_02.lore: The CoTEC S-576 is one of the standard firearms used aboard Federation ships, stations, and outposts. Lightweight, compact, and produced in mass by various manufacturers, this model is a staple in practically every weapons market. This model doesn't look quite right, but it still gets the job done.

WP_E_SMG_Bullet_01_Scrappy.name: Rusty S-576 PDW
WP_E_SMG_Bullet_01_Scrappy.description: A rusty used SMG with high rate of fire, still has some worth in close range engagements. Audible range: 350m

WP_E_Pistol_Bullet_01.name: K-28
WP_E_Pistol_Bullet_01.description: A standard semi-automatic pistol. An effective sidearm for any Prospector. Audible range: 300m
WP_E_Pistol_Bullet_01.lore: With a design that's seen no change in over two centuries, the CoTEC K-28 is one of the most popular weapons throughout known space, as are its many knock offs.

Weapons_WP_A_BR_Bullet_01.name: KBR Longshot
Weapons_WP_A_BR_Bullet_01.description: A marksman rifle with good accuracy and power. Excels in medium range engagements. Audible range: 450m
Weapons_WP_A_BR_Bullet_01.lore: The predecessor to the KOR-47, the Longshot was developed for the Federation to serve as a long range support weapon for ground troops. Designed with a low unit cost in mind, Korolev opted to ensure high accuracy and power over developing a fully automatic weapon.

Weapons_WP_A_BR_Bullet_02.name: KBR Longshot - Prototype
Weapons_WP_A_BR_Bullet_02.description: An older version of the KBR given to Korolev's on-site security forces, who weren't expected to fire on any targets with proper shields.  Audible range: 450m
Weapons_WP_A_BR_Bullet_02.lore: The predecessor to the KOR-47, the Longshot was developed for the Federation to serve as a long range support weapon for ground troops. Designed with a low unit cost in mind, Korolev opted to ensure high accuracy and power over developing a fully automatic weapon.

Weapons_WP_D_BR_Shard_01.name: Lacerator
Weapons_WP_D_BR_Shard_01.description: A capable marksman rifle, has a decent fire rate, accuracy, and good handling. Audible range: 450m
Weapons_WP_D_BR_Shard_01.lore: Building upon the the ICA's own Shattergun, this battle rifle is tuned to discharge the crystaline shards it uses as ammunition in a more controlled and accurate burst.

Weapons_WP_A_Sniper_Gauss_01.name: KARMA-1
Weapons_WP_A_Sniper_Gauss_01.description: While heavy and requiring a charge-up to fire, a direct hit from will cripple if not outright kill almost any target. Audible range: 500m
Weapons_WP_A_Sniper_Gauss_01.lore: The Korolev Advanced Recursive Magnetic Artillery, first prototype, is a miniaturization of the sort of weaponry more commonly found on warships, offered exclusively to the Prospectors for early testing. While no longer powerful enough to take down a spacecraft, it's more than enough to handle the threats of Fortuna III.

Weapons_WP_A_Sniper_Gauss_02.name: KARMA-1 - Prototype
Weapons_WP_A_Sniper_Gauss_02.description: More accurately called the KARMA-XT, prototypes like this were built on Fortuna III and tested extensively in the field, mostly against harmless wildlife. Features a less powerful battery than the KARMA-1 release version. Audible range: 500m
Weapons_WP_A_Sniper_Gauss_02.lore: The Korolev Advanced Recursive Magnetic Artillery, first prototype, is a miniaturization of the sort of weaponry more commonly found on warships, offered exclusively to the Prospectors for early testing. While no longer powerful enough to take down a spacecraft, it's more than enough to handle the threats of Fortuna III.

Weapons_WP_D_SMG_Energy_01.name: Voltaic Brute
Weapons_WP_D_SMG_Energy_01.description: An SMG with high versatility in its effective range. Audible range: 350m
Weapons_WP_D_SMG_Energy_01.lore: Using parts built on Prospect station with material from the surface combined with salvaged components from power tools meant to build starships, the ICA's 'Brute' more than lives up to its name.

Weapons_WP_E_Launch_Nade_01.name: FF4 Detonator
Weapons_WP_E_Launch_Nade_01.description: A standard grenade launcher with a high damage output; it requires skilled use to operate efficiently.
Weapons_WP_E_Launch_Nade_01.lore: Initially intended for use by colonists to clear out vermin en masse, the Detonator's payload has been modified for larger and more dangerous targets. This one seems to be from even before the colony was founded.

Weapons_Launcher_Epsilon_Grenade02.name: FF4 Detonator
Weapons_Launcher_Epsilon_Grenade02.description: A standard grenade launcher with a high damage output; it requires skilled use to operate efficiently.
Weapons_Launcher_Epsilon_Grenade02.lore: Initially intended for use by colonists to clear out vermin en masse, the Detonator's payload has been modified for larger and more dangerous targets.

Weapons_WP_G_AR_Beam_01.name: Gorgon
Weapons_WP_G_AR_Beam_01.description: A powerful beam rifle that needs charging up to fire. Not the easiest to handle, but lethal in proper hands. Audible range: 350m
Weapons_WP_G_AR_Beam_01.lore: The Zeus' little sister, the Gorgon may not be as devastating, but its glare can leave any target petrified in place. And crispy.

Weapons_WP_A_SGun_Energy_01.name: PKR Maelstrom
Weapons_WP_A_SGun_Energy_01.description: A semi-automatic shotgun; heavy and a poor choice at range, but utterly devastating up close. Audible range: 350m
Weapons_WP_A_SGun_Energy_01.lore: Korolev's first attempt at a building a phase weapon, the Phase-Kinetic Reactive 'Maelstrom's' ammo pack carries more than enough energy to fulminate whatever gets in its way in a matter of seconds, provided it's close enough.

Weapons_WP_G_Sniper_Energy_01.name: Basilisk
Weapons_WP_G_Sniper_Energy_01.description: A phase tech marksman rifle; the impacts are powerful for its class, and it boasts a high rate of fire. Audible range: 450m
Weapons_WP_G_Sniper_Energy_01.lore: The result of an offshoot project during early development of the Phasic Lancer, the Basilisk trades higher ammo count for a much stronger energy discharge. While still in the prototyping, Osiris is happy to offer this rifle to Prospectors of a high enough standing.

Weapons_WP_D_HVY_Exotic_01.name: HAZE
Weapons_WP_D_HVY_Exotic_01.description: A slow firing launcher, projectiles create a harming energy field on impact. Further discharges of the launcher into an active field feed into it, until reaching a critical point resulting in a devastating release of energy.
Weapons_WP_D_HVY_Exotic_01.lore: Discovered while developing an a veltecite-powered plasma cannon, High Amplitude Zender Emmissions were found to have an effect remarkably similar to the effect of the energy field known as 'The Cycle', though the decaying plasma core fueling it is much shorter lived than the anomaly surrounding Fortuna III.

Weapons_WP_G_AR_Needle_01.name: Manticore
Weapons_WP_G_AR_Needle_01.description: A flechette assault rifle; it's heavy hitting, but less accurate compared to similar rifles. Audible range: 400m
Weapons_WP_G_AR_Needle_01.lore: Intended for use in pressurised environments, the Manticore was designed for more militaristic use than the compact Asp. Lightweight, accurate, and lethal, it's seen use by marines both performing as and defending against boarding parties.

Weapons_WP_G_AR_Needle_02.name: Manticore - Mk.II
Weapons_WP_G_AR_Needle_02.description: The Harbinger Expeditionary Corps. variant of the Manticore, more powerful than the civilian Manticore available for sale. Audible range: 400m
Weapons_WP_G_AR_Needle_02.lore: Intended for use in pressurised environments, the Manticore was designed for more militaristic use than the compact Asp. Lightweight, accurate, and lethal, it's seen use by marines both performing as and defending against boarding parties.

Weapons_WP_A_SMG_Shard_01.name: KM-9 'Scrapper'
Weapons_WP_A_SMG_Shard_01.description: A rapid-firing shard SMG; a good choice for taking out targets at close range, though of little use in long range engagements. Audible range: 350m
Weapons_WP_A_SMG_Shard_01.lore: Faced with an ever-increasing surplus of adrentite sludge, an inventive Korolev waste management engineer brought forth a novel way of handling the hazardous byproduct: shoot it. The 'Scrapper' was the first viable weapon produced by Korolev Munitions, one of the megacorp's many competing arms manufacturing branches, and the first known to use adrentite crystals as ammunition.

Weapons_WP_E_AR_Energy_01.name: AR-55 Autorifle
Weapons_WP_E_AR_Energy_01.description: A decent fully automatic rifle; doesn't excel in any one department, but it's effective and versatile. Audible range: 400m
Weapons_WP_E_AR_Energy_01.lore: The AR-55 Phase Autorifle was commissioned by the IFA in an attempt to improve standard Authority armament without further increasing their reliance on Korolev Heavy Industries. While the IFA would eventually settle with the SAR-62, CoTEC's AR-55 remains a popular weapon in private armies and corporate security forces, and has succeeded at being an effective market counter to the popular KOR-47.

Weapons_WP_E_AR_Energy_02.name: AR-55 Autorifle - Mk.II
Weapons_WP_E_AR_Energy_02.description: A contraband version of the AR-55, originally intended for use in the Demia Rebellion. More powerful than the mass produced version CoTEC would later sell to various frontier worlds. Audible range: 400m
Weapons_WP_E_AR_Energy_02.lore: The AR-55 Phase Autorifle was commissioned by the IFA in an attempt to improve standard Authority armament without further increasing their reliance on Korolev Heavy Industries. While the IFA would eventually settle with the SAR-62, CoTEC's AR-55 remains a popular weapon in private armies and corporate security forces, and has succeeded at being an effective market counter to the popular KOR-47.

WP_E_AR_Energy_01_Scrappy.name: Rusty AR-55 Autorifle
WP_E_AR_Energy_01_Scrappy.description: A rusty automatic rifle, doesn't seem to excel anymore. Audible range: 400m

Weapons_WP_E_SGun_Bullet_01.name: B9 Trenchgun
Weapons_WP_E_SGun_Bullet_01.description: Pump-action shotgun with high-spread and short range. Yep, it's a shotgun, all right. Audible range: 350m

WP_E_SGun_Bullet_01_Scrappy.name: Rusty B9 Trenchgun
WP_E_SGun_Bullet_01_Scrappy.description: Rusty Pump-action shotgun, high-spread, short range. Just a bit damaged. Audible range: 350m

Weapons_WP_D_LMG_Energy_01.name: ICA Guarantee
Weapons_WP_D_LMG_Energy_01.description: A fast firing phase LMG, perfect for pinning down targets. Audible range: 400m
Weapons_WP_D_LMG_Energy_01.lore: This Fortuna III custom isn't known for its finesse, but it'll chew through any target if the user manages keep it under control. With the amount of ammo expended, you're Guaranteed to hit something!

Weapons_WP_D_LMG_Energy_02.name: ICA Guarantee - Prototype
Weapons_WP_D_LMG_Energy_02.description: A less powerful version of the Guarantee, originally intended for when more conventional methods of pest control were not enough. Audible range: 400m
Weapons_WP_D_LMG_Energy_02.lore: This Fortuna III custom isn't known for its finesse, but it'll chew through any target if the user manages keep it under control. With the amount of ammo expended, you're Guaranteed to hit something!

Weapons_WP_G_HVY_Beam_01_Event_01.name: Holiday Zeus Beam
Weapons_WP_G_HVY_Beam_01_Event_01.description: A less powerful version of the Zeus, mass produced just in time for the holidays.  Called 'Zeus' for turning any mortal into the God of Lightning, this heavy weapon will fulminate any creature that meets your jolly ire.
Weapons_WP_G_HVY_Beam_01_Event_01.lore: NOTE: This item will only be available during the holidays!

Weapons_WP_D_Pistol_Bullet_01_Event_01.name: Holiday Bulldog
Weapons_WP_D_Pistol_Bullet_01_Event_01.description: Not quite a snowball launcher, unless you ever played with Kevin and his iceballs.  While very very mean at close range, in its default configuration it suffers from very limited range.
Weapons_WP_D_Pistol_Bullet_01_Event_01.lore: NOTE: This item will only be available during the holidays!

WP_A_Sniper_Shard_01.name: Suppressed Prototype Sniper
WP_A_Sniper_Shard_01.description: A suppressed sniper in a lightweight design firing shards allowing it to be less noticeable and easier to reposition.

Ammo_Derelict.name: Derelict Ammo
Ammo_Derelict.description: Rusty old ammo cartridge. It's safe to sell or throw away.

Weapons_TOOL_MineralScanner_01.name: Scanner
Weapons_TOOL_MineralScanner_01.description: A versatile scanning device connected to the user's HUD that renders the outline of nearby obstacles and solid objects, even in low visibility situations (such as darkness, fog, or smoke).   By default, it's also able to accurately detect Nickel deposits, but can be modified with special attachments to detect various other valuable mineral types found on the surface.

Weapons_TOOL_AdvancedMineralScanner.name: Advanced Scanner
Weapons_TOOL_AdvancedMineralScanner.description: A more advanced Korolev version of the common scanning device that is able to detect any form of valuable minerals.

Weapons_TOOL_Pickaxe_01.name: Pickaxe
Weapons_TOOL_Pickaxe_01.description: A Prospector's trusty pickaxe, used to tear valuable minerals from veins and deposits on Fortuna III.

Weapons_TOOL_Mining_01.name: Heavy Mining Tool
Weapons_TOOL_Mining_01.description: An experimental automatic Mining tool designed by Korolev to allow for more efficient extraction of Minerals from Fortuna III.

Weapons_TOOL_Binocular_Basic_01.name: Binocular
Weapons_TOOL_Binocular_Basic_01.description: Used to look at things at a distance

Weapons_TOOL_MessaggePost_01.name: MessagePost
Weapons_TOOL_MessaggePost_01.lore: Message Post are easy to create in the future.

Weapons_TOOL_FlareGun_01.name: Flare Gun
Weapons_TOOL_FlareGun_01.lore: Flares are easy to create in the future.

Weapons_TOOL_Stormbrella_01.name: Stormbrella
Weapons_TOOL_Stormbrella_01.description: When active attracts and protects from Lightning strikes during the Storm
Weapons_TOOL_Stormbrella_01.lore: Those lightning strikes can be deadly...
